title: Customer Support Representative – Luxury Travel & Airport Services (Remote)
description:
Qualifications:



- Previous experience in the travel industry is a must (travel agency, airline, or airport operations).



- Excellent written and spoken English communication skills.



- Proficiency in Microsoft Excel and ability to manage multiple systems simultaneously.



- Good knowledge of world geography and travel destinations.



- Strong technical and multitasking skills – you’ll be using multiple tools and systems daily.



- Access to a computer or laptop, fast, reliable Wi-Fi, and a working phone for calls.



- Ability to remain productive and responsive in a fast-paced environment – no calls or email left unanswered.



- Detail-oriented with high accuracy in data entry and documentation.



- Willingness to work early mornings, late nights, weekends, and public holidays (varied shifts).



Job Description:



- Respond promptly to all incoming calls, emails, and messages related to pre- and post-service requests.



- Manage new bookings — verify details, confirm service information, and ensure accuracy in data entry.



- Confirm that all required details are collected, verified, and communicated clearly to the client.



- Create and send invoices, track payments, and record transactions in the client database.



- Assist clients with special travel requests or last-minute changes.



- Communicate proactively with the manager on duty about urgent cases, complaints, or additional tasks.



- Ensure all new orders, changes, and cancellations follow company policy and time-frame rules.



- Promote and cross-sell additional services and return-trip assistance when appropriate.

title: Business Support Specialist
description:
Business Support Specialist



Elevate Management, LLC is a professional management consulting firm headquartered in Pittsburgh, PA. We specialize in Vendor Management Services (VMS), Procurement, and Cost Management, along with Program & Project Management, Project Controls, Risk Management, Professional Training, and Quality Assurance/Quality Control (QA/QC). We are a Diverse Minority Woman Owned Small Business (WOSB) committed to collaborating with clients in both the private and public sectors, delivering customized solutions that align with their strategic objectives.



We are seeking a detail-oriented and proactive Business Support Specialist to join our growing team. This is a remote, part-time position with the opportunity to transition to full-time based on performance.



In this role, you will support our business development efforts by researching and identifying potential clients, conducting outreach via
 and LinkedIn, qualifying leads, and maintaining accurate records in our CRM. You will also assist with preparing proposals, bid documents, and presentation materials. As trust is established, responsibilities may expand to include bookkeeping support such as transaction categorization, reconciliations, and financial reporting.



The ideal candidate has excellent written and verbal English communication skills, is comfortable interacting with US-based clients, and thrives in a fast-paced environment where initiative is valued. We are looking for someone with at least 2 years of experience in business development, lead generation, administrative support, or a related field. An accounting degree or background is a plus. Experience with CRM tools, Microsoft Office, and proposal preparation is preferred.



This position starts at 20 hours per week (5 hours per day), with working hours aligned to US Eastern timezone. We begin with a 30-day paid trial, followed by a 90-day probationary period, with the opportunity to extend to full-time if it's a good fit.



If you are a self-starter with strong communication and organizational skills, we'd love to hear from you.



To apply, please submit your resume and a brief introduction about yourself.

title: Commercial Cleaning Lead Generation Specialist (US Market)
description:
We are a US-based commercial cleaning company looking for a highly organized and detail-oriented Lead Generation Specialist to help us grow.



Your role will focus on researching and collecting qualified commercial leads in Minnesota and surrounding areas.



Responsibilities:



• Research commercial properties and businesses (offices, medical clinics, dental offices, warehouses, property managers, etc.)

• Identify decision-makers (Office Manager, Property Manager, Facility Manager, Owner)

• Find verified
s and direct contact information

• Add 30–50 qualified leads daily into our Google Sheet CRM

• Organize leads by industry and location

• Flag high-value prospects

• Maintain accuracy and attention to detail



This is NOT a cold calling job.

This is a research and lead-building role.



Requirements:



• Experience with B2B lead generation

• Experience using LinkedIn, Google Maps, Apollo, Hunter, or similar tools

• Strong English comprehension

• Ability to follow structured SOP

• Reliable internet and availability during US business hours overlap preferred



We are looking for someone long-term. If performance is strong, this role will expand into
 outreach and appointment setting.



To apply, please answer:

 1. What tools have you used for lead generation?

 2. How many leads can you generate per day?

 3. Provide a sample of 5 commercial leads (any US city is fine).

We need a freelancer to help us become discoverable in AI assistants (ChatGPT, Claude, Perplexity, etc.) when users ask for a probate or trust realtor in Los Angeles. This project has two main components:

• Build and publish a custom GPT in the OpenAI GPT Store that positions us as the go-to LA probate real estate authority

• Execute a content and backlink strategy on our Squarespace website to maximize AI discoverability across all major AI platforms

This is not a script-reading job — we are looking for a conversational, consultative caller who sounds fully US-neutral and can handle real business conversations.



This role focuses on quality conversations and appointment setting — not hard selling.



?



???? Role Objective



Make outbound B2B calls to companies on our provided lists to:

 • Reach warehouse and purchasing decision makers

 • Ask discovery questions about packaging usage

 • Identify correct contacts and buying activity

 • Gather account intelligence

 • Book 20-minute intro meetings

 • Log detailed notes in our CRM

 • Keep every interaction positive and professional



?



???? Responsibilities

 • Book meetings directly on our calendar (approved time windows only)

 • Write clear call summaries and CRM notes

 • Send daily activity reports



?



???? Required Skills

 • Excellent spoken English

 • Fully US-neutral accent required

 • Strong conversational ability (not robotic)

 • Confident but friendly phone presence

 • Good listening and note-taking skills

 • Able to ask follow-up questions naturally

 • Comfortable handling light objections

 • Professional with gatekeepers and managers

 • Efficient and respectful of call time



?



???? Tools Used

 • Google Sheets / Excel

CRM experience is a plus.

title: Project manager
description:
Job Title

Project Manager – AI Operations & Delivery

About the Company

We’re building a managed AI agent service that helps businesses reduce repetitive admin and run more smoothly.

We design, deploy, and maintain AI agents that handle operational and outreach tasks (enquiries, routing, follow-ups, summaries), allowing teams to focus on higher-value work. This is a service-led business, not a software platform or chatbot company.

Our focus is reliability, clarity, and calm execution.

The Role

We’re looking for a Project Manager to own client delivery from onboarding through go-live and ongoing optimisation.

This role is about coordination, structure, and follow-through. You’ll sit between sales, prompt/agent engineering, and the client, making sure projects move smoothly, on scope, and without chaos.

This is not a technical PM role, but you must be comfortable working with automation, workflows, and AI-based systems.

What You’ll Be Responsible For

Managing client onboarding and delivery timelines

Translating client requirements into clear delivery tasks

Coordinating work between prompt engineers, automation builders, and stakeholders

Keeping projects on scope, on time, and well-documented

Managing change requests and expectations calmly

Ensuring clients feel informed and confident throughout delivery

Overseeing handover into managed, ongoing service

You’ll be the person who makes sure nothing slips, even as multiple projects run in parallel.

Who We’re Looking For

You’re likely a good fit if you:

Are highly organised and methodical

Communicate clearly and calmly with clients

Enjoy bringing order to messy processes

Are comfortable managing technical-adjacent projects without being hands-on technical

Prefer structured delivery over constant firefighting

Experience

Proven experience as a Project Manager (agency, SaaS, IT services, or operations preferred)

Comfortable managing multiple stakeholders

Experience with automation, digital tools, or systems projects is a strong plus

Familiarity with tools like Notion, Google Workspace, Slack, ClickUp, Asana, etc.

What This Role Is Not

Not software engineering

Not product management

Not marketing project management

Not startup chaos

This is about predictable, repeatable delivery.

Working Style

Calm, professional, and structured

Clear documentation and communication

No unnecessary meetings

Focus on outcomes, not activity

Contract / Location

Remote-friendly

Contract or permanent (open to discussion)

Part-time initially, with potential to grow

How to Apply

Send:

A short introduction

A brief summary of relevant project experience

One-Line Summary (For Job Boards)

Own the delivery of reliable AI systems that quietly run the repetitive parts of real businesses.

Ready to take your career to the next level?

title: Senior Conversion-Focused Web Designer Needed
description:
We are looking for a senior-level web designer who can build and design a modern 2026-ready online course platform. This is not for a junior or someone who only makes “nice looking” websites. We need a true expert who understands design, user psychology, and conversion at a high level.



The project involves designing the full experience of an online education platform: the public-facing website, high-converting sales pages, the user profile area, student dashboard, and the admin interface. Everything must feel premium, clean, modern, and strategically structured. The design should not only look strong, but guide the user naturally toward taking action and completing payment.



You must deeply understand customer flow. From the 
nt a visitor lands on the homepage until they purchase and access their course, every step must be intentional. Layout, spacing, typography, hierarchy, call-to-actions, and user journey must be optimized for clarity and conversion. The interface should remove friction, build trust instantly, and create 
ntum toward buying.



We only want to work with experienced professionals who have worked on serious projects before. If you have built high-level SaaS platforms, course platforms, or high-converting e-commerce funnels, we want to see it. Show us your portfolio and real case studies. Social proof is required.



If you understand how design directly increases revenue, improves retention, and strengthens brand positioning, then you are the type of expert we are looking for.

title: Marketing Operations & AI Systems Specialist (GHL Expert)
description:
Role: Marketing Ops / Lead Management / Administration VA



Location: Remote (Philippines Preferred for AEST/AEDT alignment)



Type: Full-Time (40 hours/week)



About the Role



We are an Australian based education provider seeking a versatile, systems-minded Virtual Assistant. This is a "Hybrid Role" that combines high-level AI/Systems Architecture with the essential Operational Grind of lead management and general administration.



You will be the "Engine Room" of the business—ensuring no lead is left behind, the systems are running 24/7, and the administrative burden on the Director is minimized.



Key Responsibilities

1. Lead Management & Conversion (The Sales Engine)

-Multi-Channel Response: Manage incoming inquiries across Phone Calls, SMS,
, and Social DMs(Meta/Google/Reels).

- Speed-to-Lead: Proactively call and message new leads within 5 minutes to drive enrollments.

- Pipeline Management: Move leads through the CRM (GoHighLevel), ensuring notes are updated and follow-ups are scheduled.

2. Systems & AI Architecture (Go High Level (GHL) Expert)

- GHL Management: Maintain the GHL CRM, with particular expertise in building and maintaining workflows, AI Knowledge Bases, and lead-nurture sequences.

- System Health: Perform daily checks on Ad Account status and payment health to prevent downtime and ads remain "Active."

- Automation: Build and refine workflows to streamline the student journey from "Inquiry" to "Enrolled."

3. Social Media & Content Management

- Posting & Scheduling: Manage the posting schedule for social media, includingMeta 
/Instagram), TikTok, and LinkedIn.

- Content Implementation: Take raw assets (videos/images) and post them as Reels/Stories/Posts with engaging, brand-aligned captions.

- Engagement: Monitor comments and IMs daily, pivoting social conversations into the CRM as warm leads.

4. Class Operations & Booking Management

- Bookeo Administration: Full management of the Bookeo booking system—monitoring enrollments, updating schedules, and ensuring class capacities are optimized.

- Class Preparation: Preparing class lists, student files, and ensuring all administrative requirements are ready for the trainers.

- On-the-Ground Liaison: Communicating with onsite staff in Melbourne to coordinate facility access, student arrivals, and resolve any immediate logistical issues.

5. General Administration

- Inbox Management: Full management of business
 accounts—filtering, responding, and escalating where necessary.

- General Admin: Assist with a wide range of administrative tasks including data entry, basic reporting, document preparation, and other clerical support as required by the Director.

- Reporting: Providing regular reports on performance, such as on bookings, ad spend, and conversion rates.



Required Skills

- Communication: Exceptional verbal and written English. You must be confident making outbound calls to Australian leads.

- GHL Mastery: Intermediate to Advanced knowledge of GoHighLevel (Workflows, Funnels, CRM, and AI settings).

- Social Media Savvy: Experience with platform algorithms, hashtags, and engagement strategies.

- Problem Solving: Ability to troubleshoot technical issues without constant supervision.

- Reliability: High-speed internet and a quiet environment for professional phone calls.

- System Proficiency: Experience with Bookeo (or similar booking engines) and GoHighLevel is highly regarded.

- Coordination Skills: Ability to manage "moving parts" and communicate effectively with onsite teams.

- Attention to Detail: Near-perfect accuracy in data entry and administrative tasks. 



How to Apply

Provide your application, including answering the following questions: 

1. Provide 2 examples of AI solutions you have developed and implemented in GHL. 

2. Describe your experience making outbound calls to Australian or Western clients, particularly with sales/leads conversions/customer satisfaction. 

3. How do you manage a busy inbox to ensure nothing gets missed?

4. What experience do you have managing booking systems or logistical coordination?

5. Which tools do you use for social media scheduling and content organization?

6. Provide 2 examples of roles where you have been autonomous/self-organised to perform your duties and met performance expectations.

title: Google Ads Specialist
description:
About the Role

We’re looking for a highly capable Senior Google Ads Specialist to take ownership of paid search performance across a portfolio of client accounts. This is a hands-on optimisation role suited to someone who genuinely enjoys working inside Google Ads — analysing data, testing ideas, and improving results week over week.



You’ll be responsible for improving lead quality, reducing wasted spend, and identifying scalable growth opportunities. We’re not looking for someone to “set and forget” campaigns — we want a performance marketer who actively manages accounts and understands the commercial impact of their decisions.



This is a part-time contractor position with flexibility and autonomy. You’ll be trusted to manage your workload and communicate clearly, without micromanagement.



What You’ll Do

- Manage and optimise Google Ads campaigns across Search, Performance Max, and remarketing

- Review account structure, match types, negatives, and bidding strategies

- Identify and reduce wasted spend while improving lead quality

- Conduct keyword research and intent mapping

- Run structured testing (ad copy, extensions, targeting, landing page alignment)

- Monitor and improve CPA, conversion rates, and overall efficiency

- Ensure tracking accuracy (conversion actions, UTMs, GA4 basics)

- Provide clear monthly performance reports and short weekly updates

- Collaborate with designers, developers, or marketers where needed



What You’ll Bring

- 6+ years’ experience managing Google Ads accounts end-to-end

- Proven success improving lead generation or conversion outcomes

- Strong understanding of search intent, bidding strategies, and optimisation

- Confidence working across multiple accounts simultaneously

- Analytical mindset — comfortable interpreting data and making decisions

- Excellent written communication and structured reporting

- Ability to work independently and proactively



Nice to Have

- Experience with B2B or service-based lead generation

- Familiarity with landing page optimisation or CRO principles

- Experience with GA4, GTM, or Looker Studio

- Exposure to Performance Max in lead-gen environments



What Success Looks Like

- Consistent optimisation and active account management

- Improved conversion efficiency and lead quality

- Clean account structure and thoughtful testing

- Clear communication and reliable reporting

- Proactive recommendations, not just maintenance



Why This Role Appeals

- Flexible part-time hours

- Remote work 

- High trust and autonomy

- Interesting client work with measurable impact

- Long-term opportunity for the right person



If you’re a senior Google Ads specialist who enjoys ownership, optimisation, and seeing your work directly influence business growth, we’d love to hear from you.

title: Technical Publishing Assistant – KDP Upload & Market Validation (Rule44 Systems)
description:
I am looking for a detail-oriented, highly organized operator to take 10 pre-written nonfiction manuscripts and manage the end-to-end publishing process on Amazon KDP. This is a mechanical, technical role — no writing, creative content, or strategy decisions required.

You will act as the Technical Hand to deploy and validate my Rule44-related assets. The goal is to ensure all books are live, correctly formatted, and market-tested.

Responsibilities

Manuscript & Cover Formatting

Format manuscripts using Kindle Create or Atticus for print and ebook versions

Apply provided AI-generated covers (Front/Spine/Back) ensuring KDP sizing compliance

KDP Upload & Metadata Entry

Upload all 10 books to KDP

Enter metadata: Title, Subtitle, Keywords (8–10), Categories (Primary & Secondary)

Set pricing according to instructions

Market Testing & Validation

Conduct 1-week price A/B testing ($4.99 vs $9.99 or as instructed)

Category optimization using Publisher Rocket or similar tools

Verify “Look Inside” displays first 10% correctly with Tone B disclaimers and “Step 1” call-to-action

Compliance & Quality Control

Maintain strict Tone B (clinical, neutral, procedural) compliance across all listings

Verify all deliverables are accurate and professional

Use a binary reporting system (Done / Pending / Blocker) for task tracking

Requirements

Proven experience with Amazon KDP dashboard

Experience with technical or instructional nonfiction formatting

Ability to follow a step-by-step directive or asset map

Knowledge of Amazon SEO and category selection is a plus

Attention to detail, speed, and reliability

Contract / Project-Based (Approx. 20–40 hours)

One-Time Setup with Optional Ongoing Maintenance

title: Research & Growth Support Specialist
description:
Position Title:



Research & Growth Support Specialist (Part-Time)



Industry Focus:



Dating, Relationship Coaching, Matchmaking, and Singles Events



Location:



Remote



Hours:



10–15 hours per week (Flexible)



Reports To:



Founder & Chief Growth Architect, The Relationship Brand Growth Lab™



About the Company



The Relationship Brand Growth Lab™ is a strategic marketing and revenue systems firm exclusively serving the love and relationship industry—including matchmakers, dating coaches, relationship therapists, influencers, and singles event producers.



We help relationship brands clarify authority, build visibility systems, and create predictable revenue growth.



We are seeking a detail-oriented, research-driven professional to support our prospecting, competitive intelligence, and growth initiatives.



Position Overview



The Research & Growth Support Specialist will play a key role in building a curated ecosystem database of professionals and organizations within the love and relationship industry.



This role focuses on high-quality research, organized data management, and strategic information gathering—not generic administrative tasks.



The ideal candidate is analytical, highly organized, tech-savvy, and able to follow detailed criteria while exercising good judgment.



Core Responsibilities

1. Lead Research & Prospect Database Development



Build and maintain a highly curated list of qualified prospects within the following categories:



• Matchmakers

• Dating & Relationship Coaches

• Couples Therapists offering relationship programs

• Singles Event Organizers

• Relationship Influencers & Authors



Research Sources May Include:



• LinkedIn

• Instagram

• Professional directories

• Meetup

• Eventbrite

• Psychology Today

• Industry-specific platforms



Data Fields to Collect:



• First Name

• Last Name

• Title/Role

• Business Name

• Website

• LinkedIn URL

• Instagram URL

•
 (if publicly available)

• Niche (e.g., over 40, faith-based, professionals, etc.)

• Offer Type (1:1, group program, events, high-ticket packages, etc.)

• Estimated Market Tier (Low / Mid / High)

• Notes & Observations



Weekly Target:

A minimum of 40–50 qualified leads added to the master spreadsheet.



2. Competitive Intelligence Research

Your hourly rate

title: AI Local SEO & WordPress Growth Specialist (Long-Term Role) – Restoration Industry.
description:
About Us

We are a fast-growing Florida-based restoration company specializing in water damage, mold remediation, and fire restoration. Our goal is to become one of the top-ranked local companies in our area through strong Google Business Profile activity, high-quality service pages, and consistent SEO execution.



We are not looking for a traditional SEO agency. We want a long-term team member who can help us build and grow our online presence step-by-step.



Role Overview

We are hiring a Local SEO Builder who is strong in WordPress and understands how local service businesses rank on Google Maps. You will work directly with the business owner and help execute a clear growth strategy.



This is an execution-focused role — building pages, improving local signals, and helping us grow consistently.



Core Responsibilities



Build and optimize WordPress service-area pages (Elementor or similar)



Improve local SEO structure and internal linking



Manage and update Google Business Profile (posts, photos, optimization)



Use AI tools to assist with structured content and local pages



Upload geo-tagged images and help organize project content



Perform local citation updates and on-page SEO improvements



Provide short weekly progress updates (Loom or written summary)



What Success Looks Like



New service/location pages going live consistently



Improved Google Maps visibility



Strong mobile website performance



Clear communication and steady weekly progress



Required Skills



WordPress / Elementor (or similar builder)



Local SEO knowledge (Google Business Profile, citations, on-page SEO)



Strong written English



Comfortable using AI tools to assist with content workflows



Ability to follow structure and execute tasks independently



Nice to Have (Not Required)



Experience working with local service businesses (plumbing, HVAC, restoration, roofing, etc.)



Technical SEO basics (schema, page speed improvements)



Working Style

We value clear communication, consistency, and long-term collaboration. This role will grow with the company — we are looking for someone who wants to be part of the journey, not just complete short-term tasks.



Compensation



Competitive monthly pay based on experience



Opportunity for long-term growth and performance bonuses



Application Instructions (Important)

Please include the following in your application:



Describe how you would help a local restoration company improve Google Maps rankings.



Share one example of a WordPress site you have worked on.



Write a short example Google Business Profile post for a water damage job in “Lakewood Ranch, Florida”.



Applications without these details may not be reviewed.

Collaborate closely with our regional teams to grow an exciting portfolio of leading Korean brands, including Beauty of Joseon, Needly, Tirtir, and other top-trending names in the market.

mber who can independently oversee e-commerce operations, take proactive initiative, and consistently deliver results with minimal supervision, ensuring long-term success and stability in the role.

- Highly organized, able to prioritize tasks and meet deadlines in a fast-paced environment.

Benefits:

title: Scheduling & Routing Coordinator – Pool Safety Solutions
description:
JOB TITLE: Scheduling & Routing Coordinator – Pool Safety Solutions

Location: Remote (Australia-time zone only)

Type: Full-Time or Strong Part-Time (for the right operator)



About Us



Pool Safety Solutions is one of Australia’s leading pool compliance inspection companies operating across NSW, QLD and VIC. We run high-volume inspections weekly and we move fast.



Now we’re looking for someone who can own scheduling and routing properly. Not just filling gaps in a calendar — but optimising geography, time, fuel, inspector efficiency and client experience.



The Role



You will be responsible for:



Daily and weekly routing of pool inspectors across multiple states in Queensland, New South Wales & Victoria.



Building highly efficient geographic runs (30+ inspections per inspector per week)



Reducing travel time and maximising booking density



Communicating clearly with inspectors about their runs



Calling and confirming clients where needed



Handling reschedules, urgent bookings and last-minute changes



Monitoring job flow and preventing bottlenecks



This is a performance role. If routing isn’t tight, profit gets squeezed. Simple.



What We Need



You MUST have:



Proven experience in scheduling and routing (field service or logistics preferred)



Strong understanding of Australian geography (NSW, QLD, VIC at minimum)



Ability to group jobs by suburb, council and region efficiently



Excellent phone manner with fluent English



Confidence speaking with tradies, inspectors and real estate clients



High attention to detail



Fast decision-making under pressure



Bonus if you’ve worked with:



Field service software



Google Maps optimisation



CRM systems



High-volume booking environments



What Success Looks Like



Inspectors fully booked with tight geographic runs



Minimal backtracking or wasted travel



Fewer cancellations



Clients feel organised and looked after



Inspectors feel clear and supported



You will directly impact revenue and efficiency. This is not a “calendar admin” role. This is operational control.



Who This Is Perfect For



Former logistics coordinator



Transport scheduler



Field service dispatcher



Operations assistant with routing experience



Someone who loves maps, structure and optimisation



If you enjoy turning chaos into clean runs and making systems hum — this is for you.



To Apply



Send us:



A video explaining your routing experience



What tools/software you’ve used



One example of how you improved efficiency in a previous role



We don’t hire based on fluff. We hire based on execution. If you don't send a video you won't hear back from us.

title: Supply Chain Manager
description:
About Our Company:

We’re a fast-growing Shopify-based fashion e-commerce brand, passionate about delivering trendy, sustainable clothing to customers worldwide. Our mission is to create a seamless shopping experience through an efficient supply chain. Join our team to drive operational excellence in the exciting world of online fashion retail.

Job Overview:

We’re seeking a dedicated Supply Chain Manager to manage our end-to-end supply chain for our Shopify fashion store. You’ll oversee inventory, logistics, and vendor relationships to ensure smooth operations and delighted customers in the dynamic apparel industry.

Responsibilities:

• Streamline supply chain processes, including sourcing, inventory management, and logistics tailored for Shopify.

• Partner with suppliers and logistics providers to minimize costs and delivery times for fashion products.

• Forecast demand for seasonal apparel collections to maintain optimal stock levels.

• Manage order fulfillment, returns, and warehouse operations using Shopify-integrated tools.

• Use data analytics to improve supply chain efficiency and sustainability.

• Collaborate with marketing and product teams to align supply chain with e-commerce strategies.

• Ensure compliance with international shipping and quality standards for fashion items.

Qualifications:

• 5+ years in supply chain management, with 3+ years in e-commerce, ideally in fashion.

• Expertise in Shopify platforms, including apps like Remaze, Slack, Parcel Panel, or similar for inventory management.

• Strong understanding of global logistics (e.g., FedEx, DHL) and vendor negotiations for apparel.

• Proficiency in analytics tools (e.g., Excel, Google Analytics) for demand forecasting.

• Proven ability to optimize supply chain costs and delivery timelines.

• Knowledge of sustainable practices in fashion supply chains is highly valued.

What We Offer:

• Competitive salary 

• Remote-friendly role with growth opportunities.

• A chance to contribute to a thriving fashion e-commerce brand.

How to Apply:

Reply to this job post with your resume link, cover letter, and examples of past Shopify fashion stores you’ve worked on (include URLs or descriptions, e.g., how you streamlined operations for a store like [sample: 
]). In the middle of your cover letter, include the phrase Green Apple to confirm you’ve read this post. Applications without this phrase will not be considered.

title: Senior Bookkeeper / Finance Operations Analyst
description:
We are a growing U.S.-based multi-location services company operating multiple LLCs. We are process-driven and data-oriented. We are hiring a high-integrity finance operations professional to own bookkeeping accuracy, transaction verification, reporting support, and spreadsheet management.



This is a long-term role with stable hours and growth opportunity.



You will be responsible for financial data accuracy, transaction verification, reporting support, and spreadsheet management across multiple entities. You will not approve or send payments. Your role is to verify, document, reconcile, report, and escalate discrepancies.



This is not an entry-level VA role. We are looking for someone strong in accounting and spreadsheets.



Core Responsibilities:



Contractor invoice review and verification:

Confirm invoices match scope and pricing; flag discrepancies for management review.



Credit card transaction verification:

Match transactions with receipts; Ensure correct categorization by entity and location; track and escalate missing documentation. 



Accounts Receivable & Accounts Payable data entry:

Enter bills and invoices into QuickBooks Online; Verify vendor receipts and documentation; Maintain organized records.



Inventory tracking and spreadsheet management: 

Enter and reconcile inventory data; Maintain inventory tracking sheets for HQ and locations.



Financial cleanup and reporting support: 

Clean up P&L transaction data before accountant review; Identify duplicate entries or incorrect categorization; Build and maintain internal reports.



Spreadsheet troubleshooting and report building:

Create pivot tables and dashboards; Improve reporting tools; Troubleshoot formula errors; Write and maintain VBA/App Scripts using AI coding tools.



Maintain discrepancy logs and escalation tracking

title: Backend Developer (C#+Azure)
description:
We have a list of ~160 websites where we extract specific text/content. The system works, but it requires consistent maintenance because websites change frequently. This role is very testing + debugging heavy, and the goal is high accuracy and reliability of extractions.



What you’ll work on



Improve (even possible rewrite) our C# Azure Functions scrapers

Fix broken extraction when website layouts change (CSS selectors / HTML structure)

Improve reliability: timeouts, retries, error handling, throttling, queue-based processing

Build/maintain testing routines to validate extraction output across ~160 sites

Add logging/monitoring so issues are found quickly (Application Insights / dashboards)

Occasionally refactor or rewrite parts of the scraping logic to make it more robust



Required skills



Strong C# / .NET

Experience with Azure Functions (triggers, deployments, configuration)

Solid experience scraping/parsing HTML (e.g. HtmlAgilityPack, AngleSharp, Playwright/Selenium if needed)

Debugging mindset: you can reproduce issues and fix them systematically

Comfortable working with many different sites and edge cases



Nice to have

Azure: Application Insights, Storage Queues/Service Bus, Key Vault

Automated testing experience (unit tests + integration tests)

Experience dealing with anti-bot protections (rate limiting, headers, cookies, polite scraping)



What success looks like (very important)

Extraction accuracy increases across the site list

Broken websites are fixed quickly (fast turnaround)

We have a clear test process to verify outputs site-by-site

The system becomes more stable and easier to maintain

title: Virtual Assistant
description:
About Us

Remodel Titans is a specialized web design and SEO agency serving kitchen and bathroom remodeling contractors across the US. We're a fully remote team obsessed with delivering exceptional results for clients who are changing homes. We're scaling fast, and we need someone who thrives on bringing order to chaos.



The Role

You'll be the backbone of our operations—the person who sees a mess of tasks, files, and processes and thinks "I can make this beautiful." Your days will involve managing our ClickUp workspace, organizing client information, coordinating between tea
mbers, tracking deliverables, and making sure nothing falls through the cracks. You'll work with our developers, designers, SEO specialists, and project managers to keep everything running smoothly.

This isn't busywork. You'll directly impact how efficiently our team operates and how well we serve our clients.



Compensation & Benefits

- Competitive salary based on experience

- 13th-month bonus

- Professional development opportunities

- Remote-first culture with full team support

- Growth-oriented culture



What We're Looking For

You're someone who genuinely gets excited about organization. Not because it looks nice (though that matters), but because good systems actually make people's jobs easier. You have an obsessive attention to detail—you catch errors others miss, you notice when things don't add up, and you can't help but fix them. You're the person who naturally optimizes workflows and takes pride in turning chaos into order.



Key Skills & Experience

- Expert-level ClickUp proficiency (or rapid ability to become one)

- Exceptional organizational skills with a track record of building systems

- Meticulous attention to detail—you spot inconsistencies automatically

- Strong communication and ability to work cross-functionally with remote teams

- Proactive problem-solver who identifies issues before they become problems

- Comfortable learning new tools and processes quickly

- Reliable and self-motivated (we're fully remote)



What Makes This Different

You're not just filing things away—you're building the systems that allow our whole team to operate at their best. You'll have direct impact on efficiency, quality control, and team communication. We appreciate people who care deeply about doing things right, and we'll support your growth as we scale.



About You

You're excited to join a team that's building something real. You take pride in your work. You don't mind asking questions to understand the bigger picture. You're comfortable in a fast-paced environment and actually thrive when there's a lot to organize. You are willing to work EST standard working hours.

title: Solar Lead-to-Quote Coordinator (AU) - With GoHigh Level expertise
description:
Job description:

We are looking for a detail-oriented Solar Lead-to-Quote Coordinator to manage the end-to-end process of converting solar bird proofing leads into accurate, professional quotes within a 24-hour turnaround. This role follows a defined SOP and requires hands-on work in Go High Level (GHL), aerial measurement tools, and document preparation to ensure every lead is quoted correctly and tracked accurately in the CRM.



Key Responsibilities / Duties

A. Lead Management & CRM Updates

-Monitor and manage new solar bird proofing leads in Go High Level (GHL)

-Review and qualify lead details and create opportunities in the CRM pipeline

-Ensure all leads are worked in the correct order, starting with the oldest

-Update CRM records, notes, job status, and pipeline stages accurately



B. Measurement & Quote Preparation

-Measure solar panel lineal metres using aerial mapping tools (Metromap)

-Capture clear screenshots showing the measured solar panel areas

-Gather all required quote information, including client details, measurements, and approved pricing

-Generate accurate, well-formatted solar bird proofing quotes using ChatGPT and the approved wording and structure



C. Quote Finalisation & Client Communication

-Transfer generated quotes into the approved Word quote template

-Insert aerial measurement screenshots and review formatting, spelling, and pricing

-Save completed quotes as PDFs using the correct file-naming convention

-Send quote PDFs to clients via Outlook within 24 hours of lead receipt



D. Coordination & Process Compliance

-Organise and schedule job dates and times with clients once quotes are approved

-Coordinate and schedule installers for confirmed jobs

-Ensure each service is clearly listed and priced as a separate line item

-Follow all SOP rules to ensure accuracy, consistency, and timely delivery



Key Software & Tools

-Go High Level (GHL) – lead management, opportunities, pipeline updates

-Metromap (or similar aerial measurement tools)

-ChatGPT (for quote generation using approved prompts)

-Microsoft Word (quote templates), Outlook 
)

-Google Drive

-Pricing rate sheets



Required Skills & Attributes

-Experience working in Go High Level (GHL) or a similar CRM environment

-Strong all-round computer literacy and confidence using multiple software platforms

-Ability to follow structured processes and SOPs with high accuracy

-Ability to quickly learn and adapt to new systems and tools

-Fluent written and spoken English

-Professional, clear communication when dealing with clients

-High attention to detail, particularly in measurements, pricing, and documentation

We are looking for a visionary Fullstack AI Engineer who doesn't just call APIs, but builds and hosts the future of our agency's intelligence. Your goal is to create a proprietary AI platform where we can train, deploy, and interact with custom models—fully hosted on our own secure infrastructure.



Your Role & Responsibilities



Self-Hosted AI: You will architect and deploy large language models (LLMs) or specialized AI models on our own servers to ensure maximum data privacy and performance.



Platform Development: You will build a sophisticated web-based interface (Fullstack) that allows users to interact with our AIs and manage training processes.



Custom Training & Fine-Tuning: You are responsible for setting up pipelines to train and fine-tune models with our own datasets to solve specific agency challenges.



End-to-End Infrastructure: You manage everything from the database layer and server-side processing to the frontend delivery, ensuring a seamless and secure user experience.



Your Technical Profile



AI & Machine Learning: Deep expertise in AI frameworks (e.g., PyTorch, TensorFlow) and experience in hosting open-source models (like Llama, Mistral, etc.) on private GPU servers.



Fullstack Mastery: Proficient in modern web technologies for building the platform's UI and robust backend services.



Data Engineering: Strong knowledge of vector databases (e.g., Pinecone, Milvus, Weaviate) and training data preparation.



DevOps & Security: Experience with containerization (Docker, Kubernetes) and securing AI environments against external threats.



Who You Are



You are a "builder" at heart who loves to bridge the gap between cutting-edge AI research and practical, high-performance web applications.



You are comfortable working with complex server environments and understand how to optimize AI inference for speed and reliability.

title: GBP Specialist
description:
About Us



Door & Gate Domination is a performance-focused digital agency that specializes in custom website development, SEO, and local digital marketing for garage door, gate, and home service businesses. We are currently looking for a detail-oriented and proactive Google Business Profile (GBP) Specialist to manage and optimize client GBP listings to improve local visibility and lead generation. The ideal candidate has a strong understanding of local SEO best practices, is experienced in handling GBP issues and suspensions, and can communicate clearly with internal teams.



Key Responsibilities:



Manage and optimize Google Business Profile listings for multiple clients across various locations.

Ensure NAP (Name, Address, Phone Number) consistency across online directories and local citations.

Monitor GBP for updates, suspensions, reviews, and Q&A activity.

Post regular updates, photos, and service highlights in line with client branding.

Respond to customer reviews with professionalism, ensuring proper tone and context.

Troubleshoot and escalate issues related to GBP suspensions or verification problems.

Collaborate with the SEO and content teams to ensure local SEO alignment.

Report regularly on GBP performance metrics such as views, calls, and direction requests.

Stay up-to-date with changes to GBP guidelines and best practices.



Qualifications:



Proven experience managing and optimizing Google Business Profile listings, preferably in an agency setting.

Strong understanding of local SEO, citations, and review management.

Experience resolving common GBP issues, including suspensions and duplicate listings.

Familiarity with GBP tools and platforms (e.g., BrightLocal, Whitespark, or similar).

Familiarity with using Multilogin for managing multiple GBP profiles securely and efficiently

Excellent written communication skills for handling reviews and communicating with tea
mbers.

Highly organized with strong attention to detail and follow-through.

Comfortable creating short Loom videos to explain GBP performance or issues.

Able to manage multiple client accounts efficiently.

Fluent in English, both written and spoken

Highly responsive and detail-oriented, with excellent communication and coordination skills





Nice-to-Have Skills:



Familiarity with
 Local Ads and Yelp Campaigns

Background in team leadership or remote staff supervision

Knowledge of content strategy, including collaboration with SEO writers

Familiarity with tools like Google Search Console, Google Analytics, or local rank trackers.

Basic knowledge of on-page SEO to align with local optimization efforts.

Experience with Google Ads for local campaigns.





Work Schedule:



Full-time position (remote).

Monday to Friday, 8 am to 5 pm CST

Willing to use time-tracking tools



Why Join Us?



Join a specialized digital marketing agency focused on helping local businesses grow.

Work with a collaborative, fast-paced, and supportive team.

Be a key player in improving clients' local visibility and lead generation.

Room for growth and expansion into broader local SEO responsibilities.

Competitive hourly rate with performance incentives.

title: Amazon PPC Executive
description:
About Heroes

Heroes buys, operates, and scales baby and juvenile brands.



We are ambitious multi-brand developers combining operational excellence with customer-centricity to support parents and children through every milestone of their journey. Built by a team with a background in investment banking, venture capital, and D2C eCommerce, we have the right experience to nurture and grow brands and develop products that simplify, support, and enrich everyday family experiences.



At Heroes, we leave our egos behind, get our hands dirty, and push through obstacles to get things over the finish line. If this sounds like you, you should join us.



About the role

Heroes are looking for an experienced Amazon PPC Executive to drive key marketing activities, ensuring that our products appear high for the most relevant keyword searches.



The successful candidate will play a very pivotal role in the success and growth of the Heroes brand portfolio and be responsible for the efficient management of a significant spend budget for their brand.



Responsibilities:



In-depth and methodical keyword research - identifying important high, medium & low volume keywords to target and implementing a strategy to build rank for these.



Campaign implementation - hands-on execution and management of keyword ranking strategies.



Analysing past performance of current and new products, identifying opportunities to push performance further.



Working with our current portfolio of brands across multiple markets to help drive efficient sales.



Providing summarised and detailed reporting of key performance metrics and driving actions based on the data.



Working highly proactively with the brand management team, offering a wider perspective on product strategy as well as recommendations to grow the brand and product(s).



Being a trusted partner to your assigned Brand Manager, owning the PPC operations, driving their brands, and supporting them with insights that drive the commercial success of the brand(s).



Identifying market trends, driving the use of new features and tactics, and staying up-to-date on what’s happening within the industry.



Onboarding and integrating new brands, setting up a scalable campaign structure that allows for profitable growth.



Working with selected tools such as Helium10, Jungle Scout, Perpetua to analyse keywords, search volumes, and key performance metrics.



About you:



You should have proven experience in managing Amazon PPC campaigns, with a track record of driving profitable growth.



A strong understanding and total ownership of the cause and effect of your actions is crucial.



You will have experience managing marketing campaigns for a wide range of products on Amazon across multiple markets, with knowledge on non-PPC growth drivers.



You should be able to analyse and present performance data clearly and concisely while still being able to drill down to a high level of detail where necessary.



You will have experience using technologies and automation tools (e.g Helium10, Jungle Scout, Perpetua) to help manage activity, but also be able to demonstrate a good understanding of how these function.



You will be highly numerate and able to make informed, data driven decisions. Excellent attention to detail is essential.



You will have a strong ability of leveraging data to communicate your points to colleagues and other stakeholders.



Our benefits

15 days of paid vacation per year.

Remote Work

A standard 40-hour work week.

Please note: We require the successful candidate to align their working hours with the UK time zone.



Heroes is an equal opportunity employer looking to build a diverse, inclusive team. We hire based purely on business need, skillset, and competence and do not consider age, disability, sex, sexual orientation, pregnancy, maternity, race, religion or belief, or marriage or civil partnerships when making hiring decisions.

title: [HIRING] Direct Response Video Editor – High-Growth DTC Beauty Brand
description:
We are a fast-scaling DTC skincare brand on a mission to dominate the space. We don't just need a "video editor"; we need a Creative Catalyst who understands that an editor is the single most important person for a content engine.



If you are a technical wizard who thinks like a marketer, this is your chance to get in early with a brand that provides the resources for you to win.



???? THE VISION

Most brands treat editors like "order takers." We don't. We believe the right editor has the biggest leverage in creating a winning ad. We are looking for a long-term partner who wants to grow with us—moving from per-batch work to a full-time role with massive bonuses, and eventually, a Creative Director or UGC Manager position.



???? THE ROLE

- Volume: 3 to 10 high-impact videos ads per week + variations for testing.

- Direct Response Focused: You aren't just making "pretty" videos; you are building high-retention, cracked ads that convert.

- The Workflow: We provide the scripts, raw B-roll, and audio to start. However, as you integrate, you will be expected to independently manage the AI workflow.

- Sourcing: You must be able to source high-quality supplemental B-roll to fill gaps and enhance the narrative.

- AI-Integration: You must be proficient in the modern AI stack (ElevenLabs, Veo, Kling, Runway, Sora, etc.) to enhance production value and speed.



???? WHAT WE ARE LOOKING FOR

We don't just prioritize "insane editing skills". We are looking for an editor who uses a timeline as a marketing tool.

- Marketing DNA: You understand market awareness, consumer desires, avatars, and hooks.

- Strategic Brain: You don't just wait for instructions; you research, brainstorm, and contribute strategy to the team.

- Feedback Obsessed: You understand that an editor who has made a winning ad is miles apart from one who hasn't. You thrive on completing feedback loops to turn ads into winners.

- Speed & Reliability: We are growing fast. You must be able to sustain a high-velocity editing pace without sacrificing quality.



???? COMPENSATION & GROWTH

- Trial Period: Paid per batch to ensure a perfect fit.

- Full-Time Opportunity: We are actively looking for our "First Hire" anchor—if you prove your value, a competitive full-time role with a pathway to leadership + heavy bonuses is waiting.

- Vision: We won't just pay you; we will give you the space to grow, the resources to succeed, and a pathway to leadership within the company.



???? HOW TO APPLY

Do not send a generic resume. To be considered, you must provide:

- The Proof: A portfolio of Direct Response/E-com work (skincare or beauty preferred). *Mandatory*

- The Marketing Mindset: Briefly explain why one of your past ads was a "winner."

- The AI Edge: Mention which AI tools you are currently using in your workflow.

title: AI Content Creator & Video Editor (Construction & Trade Services)
description:
Overview

We are looking for a creative AI-Native Video Editor to help grow a leading German platform for home remodeling and trade services (Painters, Electricians, Landscaping, etc.). You won't just "edit" video—you will use AI to create "scroll-stopping" content that shows the magic of home transformation.



Key Responsibilities

AI-Enhanced Production: Use AI tools (Nano Banana, Midjourney, Google Veo) to generate "Satisfying" construction timelapses—like a messy room turning into a perfectly painted space.



Short-Form Mastery: Join and edit multiple clips into engaging Reels, TikToks, Shorts and Meta Ads. 

Add catchy hooks, subtitles, and transitions.



Marketing Mindset: Don't just follow instructions - think like a marketer. 

Research competitors in the remodeling and construction market and suggest content strategies that drive lead generation.



Before-and-After Transformations: Create high-quality visual "proof" of professional workmanship that builds trust with German homeowners.



Required Skills & Experience

The "All-in-One" Editor: You must be able to move fluidly between AI prompting and traditional timeline-based editing.



Advanced Video Tools: Proficiency in DaVinci Resolve (highly preferred due to its superior color grading and "Fusion" VFX) or Adobe Premiere Pro, CapCut or similar editing tools.



The "Hook" Specialist: You understand pacing, how to make the first 2 seconds of a construction-video so satisfying that people stop scrolling.



2+ Years Experience in short-form content creation (Reels/Shorts).



Hands-on AI Experience: You must be proficient in prompting for video and images using different tools.



Design Eye: Strong sense of composition, typography, and "premium" branding.



Industry Interest: You find construction, architecture, and "Before & After" transformations fascinating.



Reliability: You are a self-starter who can work independently and track hours.



What We Offer

Long-term collaboration.



Creative freedom to experiment with the latest AI tools.



Opportunity to move into a full-time lead creative role.



How to Apply

Portfolio: Send links to Reels or Ads you’ve created (especially AI-enhanced ones).



Loom Video: Include a 1–2 minute Loom video explaining your AI workflow and why you are the best fit for a construction-themed project.



Task: Briefly explain how you would make a "Construction Service Company in Dortmund" look viral using AI.

title: Senior Social Media & Marketing Manager (D2C E-commerce Coffee Brand) *Full Time | Remote (Asia Time Zone)
description:
Innovative global coffee brand inventing one-of-a-kind tools redefining how coffee is experienced. Seeking a Marketing Operator to own campaigns, launches, and cross-channel execution alongside founders.





ABOUT ICOSA BREWHOUSE:

ICOSA Brewhouse is a globally recognized specialty coffee brand redefining how coffee is experienced. We are shaping coffee culture around the world. (
  / 
 )



We design and invent one-of-a-kind tools that didn’t exist before — tools that elevate everyday rituals and introduce new ways of enjoying coffee.



From record-breaking Kickstarter launches to collaborations with world-class coffee professionals, our products are used by champions, in top cafés, and in homes in 100+ countries around the world. 



We are a design-led, innovation-driven brand operating in a niche we are actively shaping. We build thoughtfully, test deliberately, and care deeply about quality — in both product and execution.



As we continue to innovate, launch new products, and grow, we are looking for a Senior Social Media & Marketing Manager to take ownership of how our work is brought to life across channels.



You won’t just publish content.



You’ll help shape how new products are introduced, how campaigns are structured, and how our global community experiences our brand — while ensuring execution remains disciplined, consistent, and scalable.







YOUR ROLE AND OPPORTUNITY ON THE TEAM:

This is a senior marketing operator role. Execution is central — but it is not a junior content posting role.



You will work directly with our Marketing Lead to:

• Own day-to-day marketing delivery across core channels

• Structure and execute campaigns from planning through rollout

• Translate ideas into clear, executable briefs

• Coordinate creative production across internal, outsourced, and AI-assisted workflows

• Strengthen how our marketing engine operates over time



You will see early product prototypes.

You will contribute to campaign discussions before launch.

You will help shape how innovation is presented to a global audience.



Execution is central to this role — but so is judgment, ownership, and the ability to think in campaigns rather than isolated posts.





What you’ll own:



(1) Marketing Execution Across Channels

• Own social media execution (Instagram and
).

• Plan and manage content calendars aligned with brand positioning.

• Ensure consistent publishing and follow-through across platforms.

• Manage inbox and community engagement, including partnership or influencer communication if required.

• Execute
 campaigns aligned with launches, promotions, and collaborations.



You ensure marketing execution remains structured, timely, and dependable.



(2) Campaign Rollout & Launch Execution

• Support and execute seasonal campaigns, product launches, collaborations, and promotional initiatives.

• Translate marketing objectives into structured creative briefs.

• Coordinate creative asset development across designers, freelancers, and AI-supported workflows.

• Oversee cohesive cross-channel rollout so messaging, visuals, and timing align across social,
, and paid efforts.

• Strengthen campaign structure and rollout processes over time.



You think in campaigns — not just content pieces.



(3) Creative Briefing & Quality Control

• Create clear, structured briefs for design and content production.

• Maintain high standards of aesthetic consistency, messaging clarity, and brand voice integrity across both human and AI-assisted workflows.

• Draft copy or guide AI-assisted content creation when needed, ensuring outputs remain on-brand and high quality.

• Review creative outputs for brand alignment before escalation to the Marketing Lead.

• Collaborate comfortably in tools such as Figma or similar platforms to support execution and alignment.



You don’t need to be a designer — but you should have strong creative judgment.



(4) Growth & Operational Development

• Identify opportunities to refine workflows and strengthen how our marketing engine operates.

• Lead or contribute to structured testing and rollout of new channels or initiatives as capacity allows.

• Over time, take increasing ownership of campaign structuring, cross-channel coordination, partnership campaign oversight, and creative alignment across performance-driven efforts.



As you demonstrate reliability and judgment, your scope expands meaningfully.





What success looks like:

• Social and
 channels operate smoothly with consistent execution and strong brand alignment.

• Campaigns are rolled out in a coordinated, cross-channel manner without last-minute chaos.

• Creative briefs are structured, clear, and reduce friction across collaborators.

• Marketing execution no longer bottlenecks leadership attention.

• Early experiments in new channels or initiatives are tested in a structured way.



Over time, you become a trusted execution leader within the marketing team.





What This Role Is Not:

• Not a pure content creator role.

• Not a brand strategist role.

• Not a paid media buyer role.

• Not an administrative coordinator role.



This is a senior marketing operator position inside a growing global brand.







ABOUT YOU / WHO WE’RE LOOKING FOR:

You are someone who:

• Understands how structured marketing campaigns come together.

• Can translate ideas into clear execution plans.

• Is comfortable owning delivery without hand-holding.

• Is comfortable reviewing performance data and using insights to inform execution decisions.

• Is strategic enough to think ahead — but practical enough to execute consistently.



You are strategic enough to think ahead — but practical enough to execute consistently.



Must have skills or experience:

• 4–6+ years of experience managing marketing and/or social for a brand.

• Experience executing structured marketing campaigns.

• Experience within D2C or product-based brands strongly preferred.

• Comfortable operating inside e-commerce environments.

• Highly detail-oriented and disciplined in follow-through.

• Strong creative judgment and ability to assess content quality and brand alignment.

title: B2B Cold Callers For HUGE COMMISSION ($200/Signup)
description:
PLEASE READ THE ENTIRE POST BEFORE MESSAGING



Hey — I’m Jordan! I’m the owner of the company, and I’m personally looking for 2 driven people to help grow my business. This is not a big corporation where you’re just a number. I work closely with my team, make sure you have the right tools, and I genuinely care about helping you succeed. If you perform, you’ll be paid very well — simple as that.

Your role is to call businesses using cold outreach and schedule them for an appointment to learn about our A.I. Receptionist (a very hot service right now).



Once they show up to the appointment, your job is done. Our closing team takes over - and if they sign up you get paid $200.



What I Am Looking For

ssages

OR

• Monthly bonuses



Hours



• Part-time (20 hours per week)

• 2:00 AM – 6:00 AM Philippine Time



How To Apply



To be considered, you must follow these steps:



• Put the subject line as "dial and smile" so I know you read this in full

• Write why YOU are a good fit for this role specifically

• Do not include a copy and paste template.

Looking forward to find the right person to join the team.

mbers, ensuring quality, consistency, and discipline across the operation.

title: Video Contributor
description:
This project focuses on collecting first-person (POV) video to train AI and robotics models. As a contributor, you will record POV footage of your everyday household and work activities using a head-mounted iPhone and our specific recording application.

Contributors from any country are welcome to participate. You must already have or be willing to purchase an iPhone 11 or newer and a head-mount for it.



Recording should be done with a head mount—?neck and chest mounts are not acceptable.

Each video you upload must be of a specific task, and NOT a mix of tasks. For example, one video upload should not have you doing both cooking and laundry. Instead, you should record separate videos of cooking and then doing the laundry, and upload both separately.

Ideally, you should record a mix of tasks between 15-30 minutes long.

The space where you record your video should have excellent lighting.

Keep the camera steady with minimal shaking.

All submitted footage must exclude any other individuals' faces unless they directly consent. Additionally, no third party music is permitted in the footage to avoid copyright violations.

No children should appear in the submitted footage.

Minimize external noise during the recording–especially talking–so the audio of the task can be captured clearly and keep the camera as steady as possible throughout the recording.

Complete each task from start to finish without walking away or leaving to do another task or take a break.

Tasks should be performed while either standing up, sitting on a chair/stool, not while sitting on the ground.

Perform all activities in a controlled, slow manner.

To ensure that your footage meets the criteria mentioned above, before making your first official upload, you may need to record a few samples and then use the preview feature to watch them in the app and then discard them, since we currently do not have a way for you to see your footage as it's being recorded.

title: Web Scraping Specialist: Build Clean US List of EV Charging Install Electrical Contractors
description:
Project: Build a nationwide US list of electrical contractors that perform EV charger installation (EVSE) work, delivered as a clean CSV.



Goal: I need a coast-to-coast list of companies (not individual electricians) that explicitly offer EV charging installation services. The workflow is: scrape ? normalize ? filter to companies ? filter to EV-install signals ? dedupe ? validate ? export CSV.



Scope & requirements



You will:



Scrape US-wide sources to gather electrical contractor businesses (coast to coast).



Sources may include business directories, state licensing lists (where accessible), Google business listings, trade directories, association directories, and company websites.



Filter to companies only



Remove individuals/sole listings that are not a company entity (unless it’s clearly a business brand).



Filter to EV charging install capability



Only include contractors whose site/listing explicitly mentions EV charger installs or close variants (see keyword list below).



Clean + standardize fields



Consistent casing, phone formatting, URL normalization, remove junk entries, remove duplicates.



Dedupe across sources



Use domain/phone/address matching + fuzzy matching to remove duplicates.



Light validation



Confirm EV install mention exists (website page text, services page, or listing text).



Deliver final output



CSV + a short README explaining sources used, filtering logic, and dedupe approach.



“EV install” keyword signals (include variations)



Include companies mentioning terms like:



“EV charger installation”



“EV charging station installation”



“EVSE installation”



“Level 2 charger”



“home EV charger install”



“Tesla wall connector”



“ChargePoint installation”



“electrical vehicle charging”



“commercial EV charging”



“fleet charging”



“DC fast charger” (optional if you want to include; mark as a specialty)



You can propose additional keywords you think will catch more real installers while staying accurate.



CSV fields required (minimum)



Please deliver these columns:



Company Name



Website URL



Phone



 (if available)



City



State



Full Address (if available)



Service Area (if stated)



EV Install Evidence (the exact phrase found)



Evidence URL (page or listing link where EV install is mentioned)



Source (directory/site name)



Notes (optional)



(If you can also include “Google rating” + “review count,” add as extra columns.)



Quality rules



No spam, no lead resellers, no “best electricians” list pages.



Prefer direct contractor sites and reputable directories.



Accuracy matters more than volume.



Each record should have a verifiable EV-install signal.



Deliverables



Final cleaned CSV



README summary of methodology (sources, filtering logic, dedupe logic)



Optional: a second CSV of “near matches” (companies that seem EV-related but not explicitly stated)



Quality rules



No spam, no lead resellers, no “best electricians” list pages.

Prefer direct contractor sites and reputable directories.

Accuracy matters more than volume.

Each record should have a verifiable EV-install signal.

Deliverables

Final cleaned CSV

README summary of methodology (sources, filtering logic, dedupe logic)

Optional: a second CSV of “near matches” (companies that seem EV-related but not explicitly stated)



Timeline & pricing



Please propose either fixed-price or hourly and include:

estimated record count range

your approach and tech stack

1–2 examples of similar work



To apply (must answer)



What sources will you scrape first and why?

How will you dedupe and validate EV-install mentions?

What tools will you use?



Provide a sample row format (mock data is fine).

title: Video Editor for Paid Ads (Meta, TikTok, UGC, D2C Brand)
description:
About Us

Ace & Taylor is a fast-growing D2C e-commerce brand selling premium hair tools across Europe. We focus on high-performing direct response video ads for Meta 
/Instagram) and TikTok.



We work with a creative engine: every week our creators produce raw content, and we test multiple variations to find winners. We are currently active in The Netherlands and Belgium and expanding across Europe.



What You’ll Do (Your Core Responsibility)

You will be our dedicated Video Editor for performance ads. Your job is to turn raw creator content into multiple high-converting ad variations for Meta & TikTok on a weekly basis.



This is NOT basic video editing.

We are looking for someone who understands direct response marketing and knows how to edit videos that convert.



Your Weekly Tasks

- Edit 5–15 short-form ad videos per week (UGC + lifestyle + product demos)

- Create multiple variations from the same raw footage (different hooks, captions, pacing, first 3 seconds, CTAs)

- Add subtitles optimized for TikTok & Meta (fast, bold, attention-grabbing)

- Cut for retention: strong hooks in the first 1–3 seconds

- Follow our creative briefs, examples, and SOP

- Deliver on time every week

- Implement feedback and iterate on winning creatives

- Organize files properly (naming, folders, versions)



We Are Looking For Someone Who

- Has experience editing direct response / performance ads

- Understands how ads work on Meta & TikTok (hooks, pacing, scroll-stopping edits)

- Is detail-oriented and follows instructions carefully

- Is proactive: asks questions if something is unclear

- Can work independently once the SOP is clear

- Can handle weekly production without reminders



Important

We work fast and test a lot of creatives.

If you:

- Miss deadlines

- Don’t follow instructions

- Don’t ask questions when confused

- Or deliver inconsistent quality



This will clearly not be a fit.



Paid Test Task (Mandatory)

Before we hire you, we will ask you to complete a small paid test assignment (1–2 short ad videos) based on real raw footage and a clear briefing.

This helps both sides see if we’re a good match.



Long-Term Opportunity

If this works well, this can become a long-term collaboration with consistent weekly work, growth in responsibility, and higher pay over time.

A Path to Full-Time Opportunity:

While this position begins as a project-based, contract role, we are interested in finding a Senior Graphic Designer who can grow into a more permanent part of our team. For the right candidate, demonstrating exceptional skill, dedication, and a strong alignment with our agency’s values and goals, there will be the opportunity to transition into a full-time role. Confirmation of your proficiency in English and your ability to communicate effectively.

What happens after you apply?

Equal Employment Opportunity:



-We are an equal-opportunity employer and foster an inclusive environment. We welcome people from diverse backgrounds and perspectives to apply to our positions. We're serious about this—we are constantly striving to listen better and be better.



-Where You’ll Work: Remote, from anywhere you wish. This position is perfect for a senior graphic designer looking for a flexible, project-based role with a growing agency.

 and Instagram), motion graphics, and UGC editing work?

 (Meta), Instagram, and TikTok, ensuring high-quality, engaging storytelling and visual appeal.

title: Full-Time Editorial / Business Report Designer (Adobe InDesign)
description:
I am running a European B2B consulting & report business.



We create high-quality printed Business / Strategy Reports

(whitepaper / annual report style).

This is NOT social media design, NOT Canva, NOT flyers.



I am looking for ONE full-time designer for long-term cooperation.



Your main task:

- Layout & premium editorial design of Business / Whitepaper-style reports

- 16–24 pages per report

- Turn my final copy/text into clean, premium layouts

- Focus on typography, hierarchy, diagrams and visual clarity



Important:

These are NOT image-driven magazines.



The reports are content-heavy and argument-driven,

with approximately 1,000–1,700 characters of copy per page on average.



At the same time, design quality is critical:

- strong typography and clear hierarchy

- balanced and intentional use of white space (comfortable to read, but not empty)

- diagrams, charts and visual elements that allow the reader

  to understand key messages even without reading every line

- a premium, serious B2B look suitable for decision-makers



Tools:

- Adobe InDesign (required)

- Adobe Illustrator (for diagrams & graphics)

- Adobe Photoshop (image improvements)



Deliverables:

- InDesign source file

- Print-ready PDF



VERY IMPORTANT – Licensing rules (non-negotiable):

- Use ONLY license-free or properly licensed assets

- NO copying or stealing designs, templates or images

- Always provide image sources and license proof

- Creating your own graphics and diagrams is preferred

If licensing rules are violated, cooperation ends immediately.



Workload:

- Full-time remote

- Target after onboarding: 5–7 high-quality report designs per month

  (depending on complexity and structure)

- Quality and consistency are more important than speed



Salary & growth:

- Starting salary: ~550 USD per month (test & onboarding phase)

- Salary increases quickly based on performance and quality

- Possible increase up to 1,000+ USD per month or more over time

- Bonuses possible if clients are very satisfied



English:

- Basic English is enough

- Perfect English is NOT required



How to apply:

Please send:

1) Short introduction

2) Portfolio (editorial / business / report design preferred)

3) Your monthly salary expectation

4) Confirmation that you understand and accept the licensing rules



Applications without portfolio will be ignored.

Canva skills for simple but clean graphic assets

Self-organized and deadline-oriented

Output > hours

Clear communication

Speed without sacrificing quality

???? Why Join Us?



Work directly with the founder

Long-term collaboration opportunity

Growing finance brand with strong content strategy

Freedom in execution, clear performance expectations

title: eCommerce Growth Executive
description:
Own Category Growth, Optimize Performance, and Expand Market Dominance.



Hadley Designs is seeking a Growth Executive to take full ownership of a multi-million dollar product category, with Amazon as the primary growth channel.
