title: DM Businesses On Social Media To Set Appointment (HUGE COMMISSION: Get $200/Sold)
description:
PLEASE READ THE ENTIRE POST BEFORE MESSAGING



Hey — I’m Jordan!  I’m the owner of the company, and I’m personally looking for 2 driven people to help grow my business.  This is not a big corporation where you’re just a number. I work closely with my team, make sure you have the right tools, and I genuinely care about helping you succeed. If you perform, you’ll be paid very well — simple as that.



Job Summary



Your role is to DM businesses online using cold outreach and schedule them for an appointment to learn about our A.I. Receptionist (a very hot service right now).



Once they show up to the appointment, your job is done.  Our closing team takes over - and if they sign up you get paid $200.



What I Am Looking For



• Strong English communication & grammar

• B2B cold outreach experience (this is a must)

• Reliable internet 

• Hungry, self-motivated, and commission-driven

• Someone who knows how to start conversations and book appointments — not just spa
ssages



Pay



We offer two pay plans:

• $2/hour + $50 commission per signup

OR

• $200 commission per signup (no hourly) 

•  I prefer someone who wants the full $200 commission and is willing to work hard and be rewarded

• Monthly bonuses 



Hours



• Part-time (20 hours per week)

• 2:00 AM – 6:00 AM Philippine Time



How To Apply



To be considered, you must follow these steps:



• Put the subject line as "message and smile" so I know you read this in full

• Write why YOU are a good fit for this role specifically

• Do not include a copy and paste template.

• I don't need links, I don't need your resume, just simply tell me why I should bring you on my team.  





Looking forward to find the right person to join the team.

title: TELEGRAM MARKETING & COPYWRITING SPECIALIST - Trading Signals & Algo Business
description:
About Us



We're a fast-growing trading education and signals company helping traders worldwide achieve consistent profits through our premium signals, algorithms, and coaching programs. Our
 community is our primary sales engine, and we're looking for a marketing powerhouse to drive conversions and keep our members engaged.



Important: No AI-generated copy

This role must be done without AI writing tools (ChatGPT/etc.). We will test for this. If you rely on AI to write your copy, DO NOT REPLY.



The Role



You will be the voice of our brand inside our Free and Premium
 groups. This is not a “post and ghost” position. You will actively drive sales, nurture leads, and increase revenue through daily conversion-focused messaging.



Responsibilities

• Drive front-end conversions: convert free members into premium clients through persuasive messaging, proof, stories, trade updates, and strategic offers

• Maximize upsells: promote coaching, exclusive signal groups, algorithms, and premium products to existing members

• Content creation: write high-converting
 posts, create simple visuals, and script short videos (no editing required)

• Trade communication: share updates from our trading team, build excitement around wins, and maintain engagement during the London session

• Community 
ntum: keep both groups active, engaged, and primed for conversions throughout the day



Requirements (Non-Negotiable)

• Strong English copywriting skills (you know hooks, proof, urgency, CTA)

• Trading knowledge: you understand MT4/MT5 and can speak trader language authentically

• Sales mindset: comfortable selling, handling objections, and driving action through messaging

• Self-starter: organized, consistent, and able to execute without hand-holding

• Availability: London Open to London Close (approximately 8am–4pm UK time)

• Schedule: 7 days/week coverage (may evolve into a 2-person structure later)

• No AI writing: original, human copy only



Bonus Points

• Experience marketing forex/crypto signals or trading education products

• CPA/affiliate marketing experience

• Proven track record of increasing conversions through

• Understanding of trading education business models (funnels, objections, upsells)



Compensation

• $700–$1,400/month (based on hours and performance)

• Performance bonuses tied to conversions and upsells (discussed after trial)

• Long-term opportunity with growth into leadership if you perform



Work Details

• 100% Remote

• Full-time, long-term

• 40+ hours/week

• Coverage primarily during the London trading session



To Apply (Must Send + Must Answer)

• Share 3–5 examples of your best
 posts or marketing copy (links/screenshots).

• In 5–10 sentences, describe your MT4/MT5 + trading/market knowledge.

• In 5–10 sentences, explain why you’re the right person to run
 as a conversion engine (no generic answers).

• Confirm your weekly availability in UK time, including weekends.

• Write a
 promo message (120–180 words) selling a premium signals membership using hook + proof + urgency + CTA (must be original, no AI).

• Explicitly confirm you can do this role without AI-generated writing.



IMPORTANT: DO NOT REPLY IF:

• You rely on AI tools to write your copy, we can tell and we will test for it

• You have no understanding of trading/forex/crypto markets

• You’re looking for an “easy posting” job with minimal responsibility

• You can’t handle the London trading hours schedule consistently



This role is for closers//marketers who understand sales psychology and want to be the driving force behind a growing trading business.

title: Customer Service & Sales Representative (Forex Experience Required)
description:
We are seeking a motivated and reliable Customer Service & Sales Representative to join our growing team. In this role, you will communicate with potential clients via WhatsApp, answer their questions, and guide them confidently toward joining our trading community. Your Forex knowledge plays an important role in building trust, providing accurate information, and helping clients make informed decisions.

- Educate prospective clients about Forex trading services, tools, and community benefits

- Use your Forex knowledge to address questions and concerns clearly

- Follow up with leads in a structured way to maximize conversions

- Close clients using pre-approved sales scripts, adapting when needed

- Verify client deposits and guide them through the onboarding process

- Contribute to team targets and suggest improvements.

- Experience with CRM tools (Kommo,
, Airtable) would be great

- Organized, detail oriented, and comfortable working in a fast-paced environment



EVERYTHING ABOVE MUST BE PROVEN, please provide it in your application



We offer a fully remote, long-term position with stable working hours and performance-based bonuses for successfully closed clients. You will work within a young, dynamic, and supportive team where clear systems, scripts, and expectations are in place to help you perform at your best. We value open communication, teamwork, and personal growth, and we actively support tea
mbers who want to develop their skills and grow with us as the company continues to expand.



IMPORTANT: IF YOU DO NOT FIT THE REQUIREMENTS 



I WILL NOT TAKE IT SERIOUSLY AND YOU WILL NOT RECEIVE A RESPONSE. ONLY APPLY IF YOU HAVE PROVEN, PRACTICAL FOREX EXPERIENCE AND YOU’RE COMFORTABLE WITH CONSISTENT, PERFORMANCE-DRIVEN WORK.

title: Senior Social Media & Marketing Manager (D2C E-commerce Coffee Brand) *Full Time | Remote (Asia Time Zone)
description:
Innovative global coffee brand inventing one-of-a-kind tools redefining how coffee is experienced. Seeking a Marketing Operator to own campaigns, launches, and cross-channel execution alongside founders.





ABOUT ICOSA BREWHOUSE:

ICOSA Brewhouse is a globally recognized specialty coffee brand redefining how coffee is experienced. We are shaping coffee culture around the world. (
  / 
 )



We design and invent one-of-a-kind tools that didn’t exist before — tools that elevate everyday rituals and introduce new ways of enjoying coffee.



From record-breaking Kickstarter launches to collaborations with world-class coffee professionals, our products are used by champions, in top cafés, and in homes in 100+ countries around the world. 



We are a design-led, innovation-driven brand operating in a niche we are actively shaping. We build thoughtfully, test deliberately, and care deeply about quality — in both product and execution.



As we continue to innovate, launch new products, and grow, we are looking for a Senior Social Media & Marketing Manager to take ownership of how our work is brought to life across channels.



You won’t just publish content.



You’ll help shape how new products are introduced, how campaigns are structured, and how our global community experiences our brand — while ensuring execution remains disciplined, consistent, and scalable.







YOUR ROLE AND OPPORTUNITY ON THE TEAM:

This is a senior marketing operator role. Execution is central — but it is not a junior content posting role.



You will work directly with our Marketing Lead to:

• Own day-to-day marketing delivery across core channels

• Structure and execute campaigns from planning through rollout

• Translate ideas into clear, executable briefs

• Coordinate creative production across internal, outsourced, and AI-assisted workflows

• Strengthen how our marketing engine operates over time



You will see early product prototypes.

You will contribute to campaign discussions before launch.

You will help shape how innovation is presented to a global audience.



Execution is central to this role — but so is judgment, ownership, and the ability to think in campaigns rather than isolated posts.





What you’ll own:



(1) Marketing Execution Across Channels

• Own social media execution (Instagram and
).

• Plan and manage content calendars aligned with brand positioning.

• Ensure consistent publishing and follow-through across platforms.

• Manage inbox and community engagement, including partnership or influencer communication if required.

• Execute
 campaigns aligned with launches, promotions, and collaborations.



You ensure marketing execution remains structured, timely, and dependable.



(2) Campaign Rollout & Launch Execution

• Support and execute seasonal campaigns, product launches, collaborations, and promotional initiatives.

• Translate marketing objectives into structured creative briefs.

• Coordinate creative asset development across designers, freelancers, and AI-supported workflows.

• Oversee cohesive cross-channel rollout so messaging, visuals, and timing align across social,
, and paid efforts.

• Strengthen campaign structure and rollout processes over time.



You think in campaigns — not just content pieces.



(3) Creative Briefing & Quality Control

• Create clear, structured briefs for design and content production.

• Maintain high standards of aesthetic consistency, messaging clarity, and brand voice integrity across both human and AI-assisted workflows.

• Draft copy or guide AI-assisted content creation when needed, ensuring outputs remain on-brand and high quality.

• Review creative outputs for brand alignment before escalation to the Marketing Lead.

• Collaborate comfortably in tools such as Figma or similar platforms to support execution and alignment.



You don’t need to be a designer — but you should have strong creative judgment.



(4) Growth & Operational Development

• Identify opportunities to refine workflows and strengthen how our marketing engine operates.

• Lead or contribute to structured testing and rollout of new channels or initiatives as capacity allows.

• Over time, take increasing ownership of campaign structuring, cross-channel coordination, partnership campaign oversight, and creative alignment across performance-driven efforts.



As you demonstrate reliability and judgment, your scope expands meaningfully.





What success looks like:

• Social and
 channels operate smoothly with consistent execution and strong brand alignment.

• Campaigns are rolled out in a coordinated, cross-channel manner without last-minute chaos.

• Creative briefs are structured, clear, and reduce friction across collaborators.

• Marketing execution no longer bottlenecks leadership attention.

• Early experiments in new channels or initiatives are tested in a structured way.



Over time, you become a trusted execution leader within the marketing team.





What This Role Is Not:

• Not a pure content creator role.

• Not a brand strategist role.

• Not a paid media buyer role.

• Not an administrative coordinator role.



This is a senior marketing operator position inside a growing global brand.







ABOUT YOU / WHO WE’RE LOOKING FOR:

You are someone who:

• Understands how structured marketing campaigns come together.

• Can translate ideas into clear execution plans.

• Is comfortable owning delivery without hand-holding.

• Is comfortable reviewing performance data and using insights to inform execution decisions.

• Is strategic enough to think ahead — but practical enough to execute consistently.



You are strategic enough to think ahead — but practical enough to execute consistently.



Must have skills or experience:

• 4–6+ years of experience managing marketing and/or social for a brand.

• Experience executing structured marketing campaigns.

• Experience within D2C or product-based brands strongly preferred.

• Comfortable operating inside e-commerce environments.

• Highly detail-oriented and disciplined in follow-through.

• Strong creative judgment and ability to assess content quality and brand alignment.

• Comfort collaborating in design tools such as Figma.

• Comfortable working directly with founders in a small, fast-moving team.



Big pluses:

• Experience supporting product launches or crowdfunding campaigns.

• Experience creating, implementing, and refining marketing processes or building SOPs.

• Experience coordinating freelancers or creative collaborators.

• Familiarity with Klaviyo or similar
 platforms.

• Exposure to AI-assisted marketing workflows.







WHY JOIN US:

At ICOSA Brewhouse, you will:

• Work directly with founders who are deeply involved in product design, positioning, and global campaigns.

• Operate close to innovation — seeing products and launches before they are introduced to the world.

• Contribute to campaigns that reach a global coffee audience.

• Have real ownership inside a small, high-performing team where your work is visible and impactful.

• Help shape coffee culture around the world.



We are a fully remote team — but we operate with structure and discipline.



You’ll be joining a close-knit group focused on building something meaningful with collaboration and accountability. There is no office politics. No unnecessary hierarchy. Just people committed to high standards.



We care deeply about growth — not just as a company, but as individuals. As we expand, there are real opportunities to take on broader ownership, lead initiatives, and shape how our marketing evolves.



If you want a role where:

• Your ideas are heard.

• Your execution matters.

• Your scope can grow with your capability.

You will feel at home here.







COMPENSATION AND WORKING STRUCTURE

Full time: 40 hours/week 

Compensation range: $1,100-$1,800 (based on relevant experience and demonstrated capability)

Up to 16 days of paid time off annually

Asia time zone working hours required







HOW TO APPLY

Are you ready? 



If you’d like to join us on our journey and grow together with us, we’re looking forward to meeting you.



We understand you may have a busy schedule, so we’ve made our application process extremely efficient. 



To apply, please follow the steps below:

1. Complete the quick application: 
 

2. In the first question of the application start it with: "I’m (insert your name) from (insert your city/town) and my favourite food is (insert your favourite food). Then introduce yourself and why you think you’ll be a good fit for this position. 

3. We’ll be in touch with next steps for the interview once we receive it. 



We look forward to reviewing your application.

title: Content Feedback Manager (Giving Feedback): $1,000–$1,200 USD START RATE
description:
Start rate: $800 a month + performance-based bonuses (TOTAL: $1,000–$1,200 a month)



Paid every two weeks via Wise.



ABOUT US







Young Publisher is an international digital marketing company working with content creators and online brands.



BENEFITS

- Full-time position: 8 hours daily, Monday-Friday; 40 hours a week

- Flexible schedule: Choose your own hours, as long as you show up for the daily meeting (MANDATORY)

- Stable income: Long-term role with regular, on-time payments

- Supportive team: Collaborative environment without micromanagement

- Growth path: Opportunities to increase responsibilities and earnings

- 100% remote: Work-from-home setup



TASKS



- Content & Client Feedback

- Review 30-60 short-form client videos (Instagram Reels, TikTok, YouTube Shorts) per day in our Slack feedback channel -before they are published

- Give constructive, actionable feedback on hooks (verbal/headline/visual), scripting, pacing, editing, and CTA, making sure each client knows exactly how to improve

- Cross-reference each piece of content with client niche, experience, and goals as outlined in their files

- Review previous feedback to ensure consistency and avoid contradictions

- Quality-control content ideas created by our Content Research Experts before delivery to the client, ensuring fit with niche, experience, and likely performance

- Oversee workload balance among Content Research Experts and make sure no one on the team is overloaded or underutilized

- Respond to client questions or tech issues in Slack within 24 hours

- Be tough but fair—only approve content that meets quality standards



Progress Tracking



- Complete daily End-of-Day (EOD) reports

- Attend daily tea
eting (mandatory, 3pm CET)

- Keep internal feedback and client progress records up to date



REQUIREMENTS (MUST-HAVE)

- C1+ English (written), with perfect grammar and clear, professional responses

- Significant experience creating or reviewing short-form content for Instagram Reels, TikTok, or YouTube Shorts

- Organized and detail-oriented

- Reliable internet and a quiet, professional home workspace

- Accountability mindset and deadline commitment

- Long-term commitment, eager to master a workflow and have direct impact on client success



IMPORTANT



- When recording a Loom video as part of your application:

- Camera must show your FACE & SCREEN

- Treat it as a LIVE interview with the Hiring Manager

- Have a professional background

- Have clear audio

- Wear business-casual attire



BONUS SKILLS (NOT REQUIRED)



- Experience supporting creators and social media beginners, especially ages 45+

- Familiarity with AI tools like ChatGPT, CapCut, etc.

- Strong understanding of trends/strategy for Instagram, TikTok, and YouTube Shorts



WHY JOIN US?



- Start rate: $800 a month + performance-based bonuses (TOTAL: $1,000–$1,200 a month once trained)

Note: Senior CFMs earn $1,500+ after 6–12 months.

- Performance bonuses: Up to $400+ additional monthly based on:

- Quality and clarity of feedback

- Task completion and consistency

- Teamwork and responsibility

- Payments: Twice per month via Wise, direct to your bank

- Tools access: All tools/software fully covered

- Work-life balance: No graveyard shifts

- Professional growth: Frequent feedback and advanced training



HOW TO APPLY



1: Message us on OnlineJobs.ph with "CFM" as the message title



2: Include ONLY the following in your message:



#1: Your CV.

#2: Your years of experience with short-form content.

#3: Your years of experience with content feedback or coaching.

#4: One sentence on why you're a good fit for this role.

#5: Your portfolio (including examples of your feedback or video/content work).



Note: Messages that do not follow this format will NOT be reviewed.



P.S. Young Publisher is the recruitment company. Successful candidates will work under Social Influence Consulting LLC.

title: AI Integration Engineer
description:
Location: Remote

Job Type: Full-Time

Schedule: 8 hours per day. The first 4 hours are flexible, but employees must be available during the mandatory 4PM–8PM (PH Time) overlap period.



Company Overview:

We are a leading Amazon brand aggregator operating in the U.S., Canada, the U.K., and across the EU. Our mission is to acquire, scale, and optimize e-commerce brands, transforming them into market leaders. We leverage expertise in product development, creative design, data analytics, supply chain management, and PPC strategy to ensure our brands outperform the competition. With a data-driven mindset, cutting-edge technology, and a culture of innovation, we continuously push boundaries to create best-in-class brands that thrive in the ever-evolving e-commerce landscape.



About the Role: 

We are seeking an AI Integration Engineer to join our team as a technical "multiplier." This role is not just about writing code; it is about strategically embedding Artificial Intelligence into our unique, custom-built ecosystem. You will complement our Automations Team by acting as the bridge between raw AI capabilities and our production environment.



Key Responsibilities

Build and optimize connections between internal APIs (NodeJS) and AI models/data scripts (Python).

Act as the "go-to" expert for the staff, translating business problems into AI solutions and teaching non-technical team members how to use AI tools effectively.

Develop, test, and version-control prompts and RAG (Retrieval-Augmented Generation) pipelines to ensure output quality.

Monitor AI latency, token usage/costs, and error rates, providing weekly optimization reports.

Maintain a clear internal "AI Wiki" that documents how our AI integrations work and how staff can leverage them.

2. Required Experience & Skills

Technical Expertise

3+ years in NodeJS (handling async requests, promises, and middleware) and Python (specifically for data processing, Pandas, and OpenAI/LangChain libraries).

Expert-level knowledge of HTTP/REST, Webhooks, and handling non-deterministic JSON outputs from LLMs.

Ability to independently audit API documentation to determine technical feasibility, rate limits, and authentication requirements for new automation requests.

Familiarity with GitHub/GitLab, Docker, and basic cloud deployment (AWS/Heroku/Vercel).

Educational & Advisory Skills

Ability to create short "Loom" tutorials or documentation for staff training.

Ability to look at a manual process and determine if it’s a "Rule-based Automation" problem or an "AI" problem.

Security & Ethics

Understands why we don't put sensitive customer data into public AI prompts and knows how to implement PII (Personally Identifiable Information) scrubbing.

A dedicated, private workspace and a commitment to using VPNs and Password Managers (LastPass/1Pass).

Must-Have Personal Assets (for remote/VA setup)

Dedicated home office setup with a high-performance laptop/desktop.

Stable high-speed internet connection (minimum 20 Mbps, with backup preferred).

At minimum: Intel Core i5 (10th Gen or newer) / AMD Ryzen 5, 16 GB RAM, 512 GB storage.





Benefits

12 days annual leave (convertible to cash)

Paid Philippine holidays (9 days a year)

Birthday leave

Bonuses & profit-sharing opportunities

HMO coverage upon completion of probation

Local & international trips for team building and brand immersion

Continuous learning: 4 hours of company-sponsored education weekly

Stock option shares for long-term contributors

title: E-commerce Marketplace Growth Lead/manager (bol.com / NL)
description:

About Onebird

Onebird is a Dutch marketplace e-commerce company selling exclusively on 
. We operate multiple fast-growing brands and generate millions in annual revenue.



Our ambition: become a top 5 seller on 
 within 3 years by building a scalable and dominant marketplace structure.



We are not looking for a typical manager. We are looking for a builder.



The role

As Marketplace Growth Lead, you are responsible for the growth and performance of our 
 business. You work directly with the CEO and focus on revenue, ranking, and conversion.



You are hands-on, data-driven, and fast in execution. You see opportunities, test quickly, and scale what works.

Focus: everything you do must increase 
 revenue. No distractions. No D2C or webshop initiatives.

This role is designed as a path toward Head of Growth.



Phase 1 – First 90 days

You go deep into the operation and fully understand how our business and 
 work.



You will work closely with CX and analyze:

- Reviews and return data

- Pricing and promotions

- Conversion and ranking

- Advertising (with our PPC partner)



You build a strong foundation:

- Review and rating improvement

- CX processes and structure

- KPI dashboards and weekly scorecards

- Quick wins on listings and pricing



At the same time, you test new growth opportunities such as:

- Influencer and affiliate strategies

- Visibility and relevance improvements

- Review velocity and ranking growth



Your goal: identify the highest leverage growth drivers and execute fast.



Phase 2 – Scale

Once the foundation is in place:



- Optimize pricing, promotions, and campaigns

- Work with PPC and external partners

- Improve systems and processes

- Help build the commercial structure

- Grow into a leadership role



What you will do

- Analyze and optimize marketplace performance

- Develop pricing and promotion strategies

- Improve listings and conversion

- Accelerate reviews and ratings

- Turn returns and refund data into actions

- Build KPI dashboards and reporting

- Work with external partners

- Translate data into execution

- No overanalysis. Focus on leverage.





What you get

- Direct collaboration with the CEO

- High autonomy and ownership

- Budget and freedom to test

- Collaboration with experienced partners

- Clear growth path toward Head of Growth

- Performance bonus based on results

- EU work schedule (no graveyard shifts)



Who you are

- 4–7 years marketplace experience (Amazon, Shopee, Lazada, Walmart, 
 or similar)

- Strong in data and commercial decision-making

- Hands-on and execution-focused

- You build systems and processes

- You think in growth, not tasks

- You take ownership and responsibility

- 
 experience is a plus but not required.



How to apply (5 minutes)

No long cover letter needed.



Send:

Link to your CV or LinkedIn

3 short bullets:

- Biggest marketplace growth you achieved (+% and timeframe)

- One system or process you built (pricing, reviews, dashboards, etc.)

- One problem you solved using data (returns, conversion, ranking, etc.)



If you want to build, scale, and grow instead of just manage, we’d love to hear from you.

title: Sales & CRM Operations Assistant (20h/week)

Role Objective



Your mission is to ensure smooth and efficient management of sales-related
s, client requests, and CRM follow-up.

You will play a key operational role in making sure no opportunity is missed and every client receives a professional and timely response.



Main Responsibilities



1?? Sales Inbox Management

(Internal

title: Sound Designer
description:
- Sound Designer -



Location: Remote (Philippines) / Project-Based

Duration: 4 Months

Level: Mid to Senior



About SS Production:

    SS Production is an audio house dedicated to crafting world-class auditory experiences for the global gaming industry. Our team has contributed to AAA titles, including Hitman, New World, and Star Wars. We are looking for a specialist who shares our passion for technical excellence and narrative immersion.



Role Overview:

    We are seeking a high-caliber Contract Sound Designer to craft world-class audio assets and manage narrative clarity through expert dialogue editing. You will be responsible for creating the "sonic weight" of the game—ensuring every sound effect is impactful and every line of dialogue is crystal clear within a complex acoustic environment.



Key Responsibilities:

• Asset Creation: Design and process original SFX (combat, movement, UI, and environmental) that meet AAA quality bars for texture, frequency balance, and dynamic range.

• Dialogue Editing: Perform surgical editing on raw voiceover (VO) files. This includes noise reduction (clicks, breaths, room tone), consistent leveling, and creative processing (e.g., world-izing, radio filters, or creature DSP).

• Cinematic Audio Design: Design linear audio for cutscenes and scripted sequences, focusing on emotional impact and narrative flow.

• Pipeline Discipline: Maintain rigorous naming conventions and metadata standards to ensure seamless hand-offs to the implementation team.





Required Skills & Qualifications:

• DAW Proficiency: Must be proficient in at least one of the following DAWs:

      - Reaper

      - Cubase / Nuendo

      - Pro Tools

• Audio Restoration: Knowledge of restoration suites (e.g., iZotope RX) for cleaning and polishing dialogue.



Preferred Skills:

• Middleware Implementation: Experience in Wwise or FMOD.

• Engine Integration: Experience working within Unreal Engine (Audio Blueprints/MetaSounds) or Unity.



Application Requirements:

1. Resume: Highlighting past experience in games, film, or any type of media.

2. Showreel: A link to your work.

title: Social Media & Email Conversion Specialist
description:
Hi! I'm Debbie, CEO of Pineway, an AI-powered platform helping coaches and consultants stop drowning in admin and start focusing on what they do best.



We have a growing, engaged audience, a warm waitlist of 700+ coaches ready to hear from us, and content that's already working organically. Now we need someone to help us convert that momentum into our first paying customers.



If you know how to turn social content and
 into real revenue, I'd love to meet you!



WHAT YOU'LL OWN



You'll work closely with our content intern, who already handles community engagement, DMs, and brainstorming. We want you to help elevate what we're already doing and drive it toward one outcome: paying customers.



Content & Scripts

- Own the full content calendar across Instagram, TikTok and LinkedIn

- Transform my ideas (and yours too!) into conversion-focused scripts and captions

- Write hooks that stop the scroll AND drive action

- Ensure consistent, high-quality content is published every week

- Bring fresh content ideas proactively and don't wait to be asked



Conversion & Sales

- Every piece of content serves one goal: move people closer to buying

- Track what drives profile visits, link clicks, and signups

- Identify what's converting and systematize it

- Collaborate with our content intern on engagement and community




 Marketing

- Write and send weekly nurture
s to our waitlist

- Build simple sequences that move cold leads toward paying customers

- A/B test subject lines and CTAs

- Report on open rates, clicks, and conversions



Performance & Reporting

- Weekly report: what was published, what was performed, what converted

- Bring recommendations, not just data

- Help us understand what to scale and what to cut



SUCCESS METRICS:



Month 1: Content calendar live, consistent posting rhythm established, first
 sequence running



Month 3: Content directly attributable to waitlist signups and customer conversations,
 open rates above 40%



Month 6: Clear, repeatable content-to-revenue pipeline with paying customers coming through social and
 consistently



MUST HAVE:

- 2-4 years managing social media content with proven conversion results

- Experience helping an early-stage product get its first paying customers

- Strong scriptwriting: you can write in someone else's voice naturally

-
 marketing experience with real metrics to back it up

- Excellent written English: warm, direct, compelling

- Self-directed: you bring the energy, you don't wait for it



You're NOT a fit if:

- Your portfolio is full of views and followers, but no revenue impact

- You've only worked with big budgets at large agencies

- You need a detailed brief for every piece of content

- You can't show us what your work made someone do



What You'll Get:

- $1,500-2,000 USD/month with raises tied to revenue milestones

- Fully remote work

- Work directly with the founding team — no layers, fast decisions

- Early equity in a pre-revenue startup with real traction — available when you transition to full-time.

- A front-row seat to building something incredible from the ground up



HOW TO APPLY:



If you've read this far, here's what I'm looking to see:



1. Record & attach a Loom video (3 minutes max) covering:

- Who you are and what you've worked on

- What's interesting or exciting about working with our tiny team

- One specific example where your content drove someone to buy something - feel free tell us the numbers and brag a little!

- How you'd approach converting Pineway's 700-person waitlist into paying customers



2. Write 3 hooks for this Instagram Reel topic: "Why coaches are losing clients because of their tools" (visit 
 first)



3. Write the opening paragraph of a re-engagement
 to 700 coaches who signed up for a waitlist but haven't heard from us in a while



I read every single application and will respond to every single one. I can't wait to hear from you!

title: Remote Bookkeeper
description:
Remote Bookkeeper – Commercial Construction (Xero | Procore preferred)



• Remote / work-from-home 

• Bookkeeping + construction admin (payment claims, retentions, supplier/subbie processing)

• Xero essential | Procore experience highly regarded (training provided)

• Thursdays are mandatory (payroll/payday processing day – AEST)



About Us

Summit Building Co. is a commercial carpentry contractor based in Geelong, Victoria. We’re growing quickly and tightening our systems, reporting, and cost control. We’re looking for a reliable, detail-obsessed bookkeeper who understands how construction businesses actually run — and can keep our accounts, claims and reconciliations tight and on time.



About the Role

This is a remote position focused primarily on bookkeeping and construction finance administration. You’ll work closely with the Directors and our project team to ensure purchase orders, supplier invoices, subcontractor claims, payroll, and payment claims are processed accurately and reconciled properly.



You don’t need to be in our office — but you do need to be highly organised, proactive, and confident working independently with clear communication.



Key Responsibilities (include but not limited to)



Construction bookkeeping & project cost admin

• Maintain clean, accurate records in Xero (coding, reconciliations, supplier statements, BAS prep support)

• Import and allocate direct costs to the correct job/cost code

• Process purchase orders, supplier invoices, and supplier payment runs

• Process subcontractor payment claims (check against scopes/POs, variations, required docs)

• Track and calculate retention (held + released) for head contract and subcontractors

• Reconcile remittance advices and resolve invoice/payment discrepancies

• Assist with payment claims: prepare/compile claim support, then adjust claims once the builder issues a payment schedule (including retentions/offsets)



Payroll & compliance

• Payroll processing and checks (timesheets, allowances as applicable)

• Superannuation processing and reporting

• Manage relevant industry obligations (e.g., CoINVEST where applicable)



Systems & communication

• Maintain consistent filing and document control (invoicing, POs, payment schedules, compliance docs)

• Use (or learn) Procore for cost tracking/workflows and supporting documentation

• Provide weekly summaries: what’s billed, what’s outstanding, what’s due, retention position, and key issues



What You Bring



Must-have

• Proven bookkeeping experience (construction/trades strongly preferred)

• Xero proficiency is essential

• Strong Excel/Google Sheets skills

• High attention to detail + ability to self-manage and hit deadlines

• Strong written communication (you’ll be liaising remotely)



Nice-to-have

• Procore experience (or other construction PM platforms)

• Familiarity with commercial construction workflows: progress claims, payment schedules, retentions, variations, supplier/subbie processing



Working Arrangement

• Remote (work-from-home)

• Starting workload: ~15–25 hours/week, with the opportunity to increase as you prove capability (and as our workload grows)

• You must have a reliable internet connection and a suitable home setup

• Overlap with AEST business hours is required for communication (e.g., at least 2–3 hours/day overlap)

• Thursdays are non-negotiable — you must be available every Thursday (AEST) to complete payroll/payday processing



How to Apply (important — filters fast)

Please include a short cover letter answering:



What construction bookkeeping tasks have you done (payment claims, payment schedules, retentions, subbie claims, supplier reconciliations)?



What systems have you used (Xero + any construction software like Procore)?



Tell us about a time you improved a bookkeeping/process system in a business.



Applications without these answers won’t be considered.

title: Social Media Manager (Instagram & TikTok) for Ace & Taylor
description:
About Us

Ace & Taylor is a fast-growing D2C e-commerce brand selling premium hair tools across Europe. We focus on high-performing short-form video content and daily organic posting on Instagram and TikTok to grow brand awareness, trust, and sales.



We are currently active in The Netherlands and Belgium and expanding across Europe.



What You’ll Do (Your Core Responsibility)

You will fully own our organic social media presence on Instagram and TikTok.

This means you are responsible for planning, posting, captions, stories, community management (DMs & comments), and daily execution.



This is NOT just scheduling content.

We are looking for someone who can run our social media channels independently and consistently.



Your Weekly Tasks

- Post 1–2 times per day on Instagram & TikTok

- Create strong captions & CTAs (engaging, on-brand, conversion-focused)

- Post daily stories (product usage, UGC, behind the scenes, promos)

- Reply to DMs & comments within 24 hours

- Plan and manage the content calendar

- Repurpose existing videos into social posts

- Coordinate with video editors & creative team

- Track basic performance (views, engagement) and report weekly



We Are Looking For Someone Who

- Has proven experience managing Instagram & TikTok for brands

- Understands short-form content and social media trends

- Can work independently without daily hand-holding

- Is proactive: asks questions if something is unclear

- Is highly organized and consistent with daily posting

- Understands brand tone and can adapt copy per platform



Important (Read Carefully – This Filters Out 90% of Bad Applicants)

We post daily. This role requires consistency and ownership.

If you:

- Miss posting deadlines

- Are inconsistent

- Don’t reply to DMs/comments on time

- Don’t ask questions when confused

- Or treat this as “just scheduling posts”



This will clearly not be a fit.



Paid Test Task (Mandatory)

Before we hire you, we will ask you to complete a paid test task:

- Create a 7-day content plan

- Write captions for 5 posts

- Propose story ideas

This helps both sides see if we’re a good match.



Long-Term Opportunity

If this works well, this can become a long-term collaboration with consistent work, growing responsibility, and higher pay over time.

title: Research Assistant and Proposal Writer
description:
Please
 your resume, video intro, and portfolio related to the position to 
 



Job Title

 

Bid Researcher and Proposal Writer

 

 

Position Overview

 

We are seeking a highly detail oriented Bid Researcher and Proposal Writer with proven expertise in government and corporate contracting. This role is responsible for identifying high value opportunities, analyzing solicitation requirements, and developing competitive, compliant proposals that position the organization to win.

 

The ideal candidate understands public procurement processes, corporate sourcing systems, and strategic positioning. If you can diagnose the requirement, you can dominate the response.

 

 

 

Key Responsibilities

 

 

Opportunity Research and Qualification

 

 • Monitor federal, state, local, and corporate procurement portals daily

 • Identify RFPs, RFQs, RFIs, and ITBs aligned with company capabilities

 • Evaluate bid fit based on scope, eligibility, compliance, and competitiveness

 • Track deadlines, amendments, and submission requirements

 • Maintain an organized bid pipeline and reporting dashboard

 

 

RFP Analysis and Strategy

 

 • Review solicitation documents in full and extract key requirements

 • Develop compliance matrices and response outlines

 • Identify mandatory forms, certifications, and attachments

 • Assess evaluation criteria and scoring methodology

 • Collaborate with leadership to determine go or no go decisions

 

 

Proposal Writing and Development

 

 • Draft compelling executive summaries and technical responses

 • Translate complex requirements into clear, persuasive narratives

 • Align proposals with agency priorities and corporate objectives

 • Ensure proposals are compliant, responsive, and formatted correctly

 • Edit and refine content for clarity, strength, and impact

 

 

Coordination and Submission

 

 • Coordinate with subject matter experts to gather technical input

 • Collect resumes, past performance, financial data, and supporting documents

 • Ensure all submission components meet deadline and formatting rules

 • Manage electronic submissions through procurement portals

 

 

 

Required Qualifications

 

 • 3 to 5 years experience in government contracting, corporate procurement, or proposal writing

 • Demonstrated experience responding to RFPs, RFQs, and RFIs

 • Strong understanding of public procurement processes and compliance standards

 • Excellent writing, editing, and analytical skills

 • Ability to manage multiple deadlines under pressure

 • Advanced proficiency in Microsoft Word, Excel, and document formatting

 

 

 

Preferred Qualifications

 

 • Experience with federal and state procurement portals

 • Knowledge of minority owned, women owned, or small business certifications

 • Familiarity with compliance matrices and evaluation scoring systems

 • Experience in consulting, infrastructure, workforce development, or professional services proposals

 

 

 

Key Competencies

 

 • Precision under pressure

 • Strong research discipline

 • Strategic thinking

 • Clear, confident writing

 • Deadline driven execution

 • High attention to detail

 

 

 

Performance Metrics

 

 • Number of qualified opportunities identified monthly

 • Proposal submission rate

 • Compliance accuracy rate

 • Win rate improvement over time

 • On time submission rate

 

 

 

Why This Role Matters

 

Strong bids build strong revenue.

 

This role drives growth, visibility, and long term contract success. The right candidate will not just respond to opportunities. They will position the company to compete, comply, and win.

title: Business development manager
description:
Business Development Manager – Managed AI services



About the Role

We’re building a managed AI agent service that helps businesses reduce repetitive admin and run more smoothly.

This role is about selling operational clarity, not software licences or hype. You’ll speak to business owners and managers, understand how their work actually flows, and help them decide whether managed AI agents would remove friction.

This is consultative selling, not high-pressure closing.

What You’ll Be Doing

Reaching out to UK-based businesses (primarily via LinkedIn and
)

Booking and running short discovery calls

Using a simple assessment to identify operational pain points

Explaining our managed AI agent service in plain English

Qualifying opportunities honestly (saying “no” when it’s not a fit)

Closing clients into a clear setup + monthly retainer model

Maintaining relationships and spotting opportunities for add-ons

You’ll sell outcomes (less admin, fewer interruptions), not technical features.

Who You’re Talking To

Owners and directors of small to mid-sized businesses

Professional services, agencies, property, admin-heavy services

Typically 5–30 staff, growing, busy, slightly chaotic

These buyers value trust and clarity over clever sales talk.

What We’re Looking For

You don’t need deep AI knowledge. You do need strong business sense.

You’re likely a good fit if you:

Are comfortable speaking with business owners

Ask good questions and listen properly

Can explain complex ideas simply

Are calm, professional, and organised

Prefer consultative selling to aggressive tactics

Experience

B2B sales experience (services or solutions preferred)

Comfortable with LinkedIn outreach and video/phone calls

Experience selling retainers or managed services is a big plus

What This Role Is Not

Not cold-calling all day

Not transactional SaaS selling

Not “AI evangelism”

Not commission-at-all-costs culture

How We Sell

Short operational assessment first

Clear scope and pricing

Full setup fee upfront

Monthly managed service thereafter

Long-term relationships, not quick churn

Compensation

Base + commission (open to structure)

Commission on setup and ongoing retainer

Remote-friendly

How to Apply

Send:

A short note on why this role suits you

Brief background in B2B sales

One-Line Summary (For Job Boards)

Help businesses remove operational friction using calm, managed AI services.

title: Graphic Artist (Full-Time / Remote)
description:
1. Company Overview



Complete Local Marketing is a premier digital marketing agency based in Puerto Rico. We believe that small and medium-sized enterprises deserve the same high-level branding and creative strategy as global corporations. Our mission is to bridge that gap through world-class visual storytelling, data-driven content, and performance-focused marketing. With a growing portfolio of 10+ active clients across various sectors, we are looking for a creative powerhouse to help us define the visual future of local business.



2. Role Summary



We are looking for a Graphic Designer who lives at the intersection of static design and motion. This is a high-impact, full-time role responsible for the end-to-end creation of visual assets for our entire client roster. You will be the "visual voice" for our clients, translating marketing strategies into high-converting graphics, polished video content, and cohesive brand identities. You will work in lockstep with our marketing strategists, social media managers, and web teams to ensure every pixel serves a purpose.



3. Employment Type & Work Schedule



Role: Full-Time (40 hours per week).

Location: 100% Remote.

Time Zone: Must be available during AST (Atlantic Standard Time) or U.S. Business Hours (EST/PST).

Time Tracking: Mandatory use of a Time Tracker for all hours worked

Hours logged through the tracker are the official record for billing and payment purposes



4. Compensation



Hourly Rate: USD $4/hour (including fees of chosen payment platform)

Invoice: Contractors are mandated to submit invoices that include their preferred payment channel.

Payment schedule: Bi-weekly payment issued every two (2) weeks upon receipt and approval of an invoice for services rendered.

Contractor responsible for all applicable taxes and statutory obligations







5. Core Responsibilities



Omnichannel Design: Produce creative assets for social media, paid ads, websites, and traditional print (menus/flyers).

Brand Stewardship: Develop and maintain brand-aligned templates for multiple clients simultaneously to ensure consistency.

Multimedia Content: Edit engaging video content ranging from 15-second Reels to long-form promotional brand stories.

Conceptualization: Participate in creative brainstorming sessions to develop campaign concepts based on client goals.

Asset Management: Maintain a highly organized library of raw files and final exports.

Efficiency: Meet tight deadlines in a fast-paced agency environment without compromising quality.



6. Graphic Design Responsibilities



Social & Digital: High-engagement Instagram/Facebook posts, carousels, and stories.

Paid Media: Eye-catching ad creative for Meta, Google Display, and LinkedIn.

Web Visuals: Hero images, icons, and custom graphics for landing pages.

Print: Occasional design for physical collateral, including menus, business cards, and event flyers.



7. Video Editing Responsibilities



Social-First Video: Cutting and optimizing content for Instagram Reels, TikTok, and YouTube Shorts.

Post-Production: Color grading, basic sound design, and audio leveling.

Graphic Integration: Adding dynamic captions, transitions, and overlays to increase viewer retention.

Format Optimization: Re-formatting a single video asset for multiple platforms (e.g., 9:16 vs. 4:5 vs. 16:9).



8. Required Skills & Qualifications



Experience: 2+ years in a professional design/video role (Agency experience is a significant plus).

Technical Mastery: Advanced proficiency in Adobe Creative Cloud (Photoshop, Illustrator, Premiere Pro, After Effects, Canva, CapCut).

Platform Savvy: Understanding of what makes content go viral or convert on modern social platforms.

Branding Knowledge: Deep understanding of typography, color theory, and visual hierarchy.

Multitasking: Proven ability to manage creative deliverables for 10+ clients across different industries.



9. Preferred / Nice-to-Have Qualifications



Motion Graphics: Ability to create custom animations and dynamic logo reveals.

AI Integration: Experience using AI tools (Midjourney, Firefly, etc.) to speed up creative workflows.



10. Key Performance Indicators (KPIs)



Content Performance: Engagement rates and ad conversion metrics of designed assets.

Turnaround Time: Adherence to internal production schedules and deadlines.

Brand Accuracy: Minimizing revision rounds through strict adherence to client brand guidelines.

Team Synergy: Success of collaborative projects with the marketing and web teams.



11. Tools & Platforms



Design: Adobe Photoshop, Illustrator, Canva (for client-facing templates).

Video: Premiere Pro, After Effects, CapCut (for quick social edits).

Management: ClickUp, WhatsApp, and Google Drive.



12. Technical Requirements (Mandatory)



To ensure a seamless remote workflow, the following hardware and connectivity standards are required:

PC / Laptop Requirements

Specs: High-performance machine capable of rendering 4K video and handling large PSD/AI files smoothly.

Operating System: Windows 10+ or MacOS 11+

RAM: 16-32 GB minimum

GPU: NVIDIA RTX 5080 (or higher)

Storage Space: At least 500GB or 1TB free for video files

Processor: i5 or equivalent (i7+ recommended)

PSU:
W

Audio: Built-in or USB microphone with clear sound

Verification: You must provide a screenshot of system specifications (CPU, RAM, GPU, OS).

Internet Requirements

Speed: Minimum 50 Mbps stable internet (Fiber preferred).

Verification: Must submit a recent speed test result screenshot.

Redundancy: Must have a reliable backup internet source (Secondary ISP or mobile hotspot).

Backup & Power Requirements

Hardware: Access to a backup laptop or secondary workstation.

Power Redundancy: UPS (Uninterruptible Power Supply), generator, or power station to ensure uptime during local power interruptions.



13. Work Environment Expectations



A professional, quiet remote workspace suitable for video calls.

High level of accountability; you are expected to be reachable and active during working hours.

Proactive communication regarding project status and potential bottlenecks.



14. We want to know more about you



These questions are designed to assess the candidate’s creative process, technical skills, and ability to deliver cohesive visual and video content while maintaining brand consistency.



1. Tell us your step-by-step process on creating a design or layout, from receiving the brief to final delivery.

2. What design and video editing tools do you use most often (e.g., Canva, CapCut, Adobe Photoshop, Davinci Resolve, Illustrator, Premiere Pro, After Effects), and which are you strongest in?

3. Can you share examples of projects where you handled both graphic design and video editing, and explain your role in each?

4. How do you manage feedback and revisions, especially when working with tight deadlines or multiple stakeholders?

5. How do you ensure brand consistency (colors, fonts, tone, motion style) across both static designs and video content?



15. How to apply



To be considered for this role, please submit the following requirements in full:



- Answer the five (5) screening questions listed in the “We Want to Know More About You” section.

- Confirmation of your ability to work 40 hours/week during AST/EST business hours.

- Complete an internet speed test and provide a shareable link to a screenshot of your results that can be viewed by anyone with the link.

- Provide a shareable link to a screenshot of your PC or laptop specifications with viewers’ access enabled.

- Submit a portfolio via a shareable link (including graphic designs, videos, reels, or motion projects) that can be accessed by anyone with the link.

- Include your CV/resume (PDF format) through a shareable link with viewers’ access enabled.

- Record a 2–3 minute self-introduction video via Loom discussing your previous job roles, industries you’ve worked in, key career highlights, why you are the best candidate for this role, and whether you consider yourself more of an artist or a visionary—and why. Provide a shareable Loom link that can be viewed by anyone.



Incomplete applications or submissions without proper shareable links will not be reviewed.

title: Remote Real Estate Sales Analyst (Full-Time | Benefits Included)
description:
Work From Anywhere | Join a Fast-Growing Real Estate Investment Firm



We’re looking for a detail-oriented Real Estate Sales Analyst to support our sales and acquisitions teams by running comps, analyzing property values, and delivering accurate market insights.



About the Role

Position: Real Estate Sales Analyst

Location: Anywhere – 100% Remote

Work Hours: Monday–Friday, 8:00 AM–5:00 PM Pacific Time

(Occasional weekend work up to 4 hours)

Work Duration: 40 hours/week



In this role, you’ll focus on running comparable sales on MLS, Redfin, Zillow, evaluating property values, talking to agents to get info. and supporting deal analysis to help drive informed investment decisions.



---------------------------------------

Qualifications

-Minimum 6 months of experience in real estate, sales analysis, or a similar support role (REQUIRED)

-Strong understanding of real estate fundamentals, including property valuation and market comps

-Ability to accurately run comps and assess values using Zillow, Redfin, MLS, or similar tools

-Connect with real estate agents to get property sales info

-Experience supporting sales or acquisitions teams with analysis and due diligence

-High attention to detail with strong analytical and critical-thinking skills

-Comfortable working with large datasets and summarizing insights clearly

-Strong written and verbal communication skills

-Proactive, resourceful, and able to work independently with minimal supervision



---------------------------------------

Technical Requirements

-Stable, high-speed internet connection

-Reliable laptop or desktop computer and smartphone

-Proficiency in Excel or Google Sheets (basic formulas, pivot tables, formatting)

-Experience with real estate platforms (Zillow, PropStream, Redfin, or similar)

-Comfortable using tools like Slack, Zoom, and Google Workspace



---------------------------------------

Compensation

-$5-$7/hour (based on experience)

-13th Month Pay

-Bi-weekly Pay



Benefits Package (Applicable once the employee is regularized after the probationary period)

-10 days of paid time off (PTO)

-Maxicare health insurance coverage

-Sales bonus for every real estate property successfully sold

-SV anniversary gifts

-Birthday gift

-13th Month Pay, with the potential to earn two to three times the standard amount, depending on individual performance and overall company results



---------------------------------------

How to Apply - Please submit:

     1. Resume (PDF or Word)

     2. Internet speed test screenshot

     3. Computer specs

     4. Short video (Loom or YouTube) introducing yourself explaining your experience running comps and supporting real estate analysis





Ready to grow with us?

Apply now and join SV Ventures — where data-driven insights power smart decisions.

title: SEO Specialist (Part-Time / Remote)
description:
1. Company Overview



Complete Local Marketing is a premier digital marketing agency based in Puerto Rico. Our mission is to provide small and medium-sized enterprises with the sophisticated marketing tools and strategies typically reserved for large corporations. We pride ourselves on being a growth partner for our clients, currently managing a diverse portfolio of 10+ active accounts across various industries, ensuring they are seen, heard, and chosen by their local communities.



2. Role Summary



We are seeking a results-driven SEO Specialist to join our team on a part-time basis. In this role, you will be the primary architect of organic growth for our clients. You won't just be managing keywords; you will be executing comprehensive local SEO strategies that drive real-world foot traffic and leads. You will collaborate closely with our creative designers and marketing strategists to ensure SEO is woven into the fabric of our clients' digital presence. The ideal candidate is a self-starter who excels at managing multiple client accounts without sacrificing attention to detail.

Reporting: Create and present monthly performance reports that translate data into actionable insights for clients.

Competitor Analysis: Monitor local competitors to identify gaps and opportunities for our clients.

Cross-Functional Collaboration: Partner with the web and content teams to ensure all site updates are SEO-friendly.



6. Required Skills & Qualifications



Proven Experience: 2+ years of experience as an SEO Specialist (Agency experience preferred).

Local SEO Mastery: Deep understanding of local citations, proximity factors, and regional search trends.

Tool Proficiency: Expert-level use of Google Search Console, Google Analytics (GA4), and industry tools (Ahrefs, SEMrush, or BrightLocal).

CMS Familiarity: Proficiency in WordPress (experience with builders like Elementor or Divi is a plus).

Analytical Prowess: Ability to synthesize data from various sources to provide a clear picture of ROI.

Communication: Exceptional written and verbal communication skills in English.



7. Preferred / Nice-to-Have Qualifications



Direct experience handling SEO for multiple businesses 

Knowledge of Conversion Rate Optimization (CRO) principles.



8. Key Performance Indicators (KPIs)



Significant month-over-month organic traffic growth.

Improvement in rankings for targeted local search terms.

Growth in Google Business Profile interactions (calls, directions, website visits).

Timely completion of all client deliverables and monthly reports.



9. Tools & Platforms Used



SEO/Analytics: Google Search Console, GA4, Ahrefs/SEMrush.

Local SEO: BrightLocal, Whitespark, or similar.

Project Management: ClickUp, Asana, or 
.

Operating System: Windows 10+ or MacOS 11+

RAM: 8 GB minimum

Storage Space: At least 250GB or 1TB 

Processor: i5 or equivalent (i7+ recommended)

Backup PC/Laptop in case of an issue

Engagement: Ability to attend and participate in virtual tea
etings with camera on.



12. We want to know more about you



These questions are designed to assess the candidate’s abilities, technical skills, and ability to deliver excellent results.

- Describe your step-by-step process for conducting an SEO audit on a website, including tools you use and metrics you analyze.

- Can you give an example of a project where your SEO strategy significantly improved organic traffic or rankings? What approach did you take?

- Which SEO tools and platforms are you most proficient in (e.g., Google Analytics, SEMrush, Ahrefs, Screaming Frog), and how do you use them in daily tasks?

title: Content Manager/Content Curator – Video Podcast Remote
description:
Company Overview:

We are 37 Projects, a fast-growing YouTube Video Marketing Agency that helps health and wellness brands maximize their reach through high-quality video content, Shorts, and podcast marketing. We’re looking for a YouTube & Podcast Content Manager who can analyze long-form podcasts, craft compelling YouTube Shorts & Clips, and ensure all content aligns with the client’s brand voice and audience engagement strategies.



I. Content Manager Responsibilities



1. Content Consumption



- Watch 1–2 hour video podcasts on health, fitness, and nutrition topics.

- Develop a deep understanding of each podcast’s themes and key messages to inform content creation.



2. Clip & Short Identification (NOT Editing)



- Identify segments ideal for YouTube Clips and YouTube Shorts.

- Select the best 
nts for intros that build a compelling storytelling narrative.



3. Content Strategy & Quality Assurance



- Ensure all clips, shorts, and intros align with the client’s brand voice and content strategy.

- Perform content-only quality checks on first rough-cut videos (focus on flow, clarity, and messaging—not captions, graphics, or motion design).



4. Intros & Trailers



- Select punchy and engaging 
nts from the podcast to be used in the trailer (approx. 70–80 seconds).

- Provide editors with timestamps and key sentences to include, ensuring the trailer highlights the right topics or subtopics.

- Collaborate with the Project Manager and Video Editor to align on creative direction and client expectations.



Example: Similar to Steven Bartlett’s Diary of a CEO trailers, which combine intro narration with short, high-impact clips.



II. Scope of Work



- Manage content across five clients.

- Watch and process around 15–16 podcasts per month (on average, 3–4 per client).

- Produce selections for around 8 trailers per month (?2 per week, one per client).

- Deliverables include weekly clips, shorts, and trailers, ensuring consistency across all client channels.

- Collaborate closely with Project Managers and Video Editors to maintain smooth production flow and client satisfaction.



III Requirements:



1. Availability & Commitment:

- Full-time remote position - no other job commitments to ensure focus.

- Must have a high-performance laptop/computer and stable internet.



2. Experience & Education:

- Proven experience in video editing or podcast production (video/audio).

- Graduates in Communication, Multimedia, or Video Production are highly preferred.

- Experience in YouTube content creation (Shorts, Clips, long-form podcasts) - a bonus



3. Skills & Tools:

- SEO writing experience is a plus.

- Strong organizational and time management skills to handle multiple projects.

- Proficiency in:

   + Slack

   + Google Workspace (Docs, Sheets, Drive)

   + Notion

   + AI writing tools (ChatGPT, Claude)

   + YouTube SEO tools (VidIQ, SEMrush) – a bonus



4. Strong storytelling ability to identify and structure the most compelling 
nts in videos.



5. Preferred Bonus Skills:

- Knowledge of health, fitness, and nutrition topics (to select key 
nts effectively).

- Creative mindset with the ability to suggest innovative content formats & strategies.

title: AI & Web Optimization Specialist (Part-Time / Remote)
description:
1. Company Overview



Complete Local Marketing is a forward-thinking digital marketing agency based in Puerto Rico. Our mission is to empower local businesses by bridging the gap between traditional service excellence and modern digital performance. We leverage cutting-edge AI tools, high-performance web architecture, and data-driven strategies to help our clients dominate their local markets. With a growing portfolio of 10+ active clients across diverse industries, we are committed to scalability, innovation, and measurable results.



2. Role Summary



We are seeking a highly analytical and tech-savvy AI & Web Optimization Specialist to join our team. In this pivotal role, you will be responsible for merging AI-driven efficiencies with high-performance web design to maximize client conversions. You will not only optimize website speed and landing page aesthetics but also integrate AI workflows and tools to enhance lead generation and scalability. You will collaborate closely with our SEO, design, and strategy teams to ensure every digital asset is a high-converting machine for our local business clients.

Power: Must have an electricity backup solution (UPS, generator, or power station) to remain online during local power outages.



13. Work Environment Expectations



A dedicated, quiet, and professional remote workspace.

Punctuality in virtual meetings and proactive communication via Slack/Email.

Commitment to documenting all AI prompts and web optimization workflows.



14. We want to know more about you



These questions are designed to assess the candidate’s abilities, technical skills, and ability to deliver excellent results.

- Describe your step-by-step process for optimizing a website using AI tools and web performance best practices.

- Which AI platforms, web analytics, or optimization tools do you use most, and how have they improved your projects’ performance?

- Can you provide an example of a project where you significantly improved website speed, user experience, or conversion rates using AI-driven strategies?

- How do you balance automation via AI with manual optimization to ensure accuracy, relevance, and website quality?

- Explain a challenge you faced while implementing AI or web optimization solutions remotely, and how you resolved it.



15. How to apply



To be considered for this role, please submit the following requirements in full:

- Answer the five (5) screening questions listed in the “We Want to Know More About You” section.

- Confirmation of your ability to work 20 hours/week during AST/EST business hours.

- Complete an internet speed test and provide a shareable link to a screenshot of your results that can be viewed by anyone with the link.

- Provide a shareable link to a screenshot of your PC or laptop specifications with viewers’ access enabled.

- Submit a Portfolio via a shareable link; Examples or case studies showing AI integration, landing page builds, or conversion lifts that can be accessed by anyone with the link.

- Include your CV/resume (PDF format) through a shareable link with viewers’ access enabled.

- Record a 2–3 minute self-introduction video via Loom discussing your previous job roles, industries you’ve worked in, key career highlights, Innovations, why you are the best candidate for this role, and how do you d
 which tasks to automate versus which tasks require manual oversight—and why. Provide a shareable Loom link that can be viewed by anyone.





Incomplete applications or submissions without proper shareable links will not be reviewed.

title: Virtual Assistant for Video Production
description:
We are looking for a reliable and enthusiastic video creator to produce simple, short “How-To” videos (2-4 minutes long). These will be voiceover screen recordings, demonstrating tasks like app tutorials, softwares, Reviews, or simple tech walkthroughs.



If you're confident speaking in clear English and video editing , we’d love to work with you.





- Follow easy instructions



- Test simple tasks (like adding products to a website)



- Use software to record the steps (no speaking or video skills required!)



Requirements:



- Basic computer skills



- Attention to detail



- Willingness to learn



This is a work-from-home role with flexible hours. No prior experience needed!



How to Apply: Send us a message and tell us why you'd be great for this simple, easy job! Please begin your application with your favourite food.

title: Administration Assistant - Australian Mortgage Broking
description:
Who we are



Blambles Finance Group is a boutique finance broking business based in Brisbane, Australia. We pride ourselves on helping our customers get the best deal from our residential and commercial lender partners.

We are looking for a self motivated and highly efficient person to support the continued growth of our business on a permanent full time basis. You will work closely with our existing Filipino based virtual assistants and an Australian based residential & commercial mortgage broker.



Key requirements for the role

• Highly proficient in Microsoft Office 365, with excellent Excel skills

• Excellent English communicator, both written and oral

• Self motivated to complete tasks with minimal supervision and prioritise competing tasks / deadlines

• Stable prior employment

• High attention to detail



You will be rewarded with

• A role which is 100% remote allowing you to work from home

• Competitive remuneration, and future eligibility for a performance bonus and public holiday / annual leave

• A flexible working environment including Australian based hours (AEST)

• The ability to work closely with our Filipino support staff



To apply for the role please,



: 

• With the subject: BFG job application – Admin Assistant

• Enclosing your resume and cover letter outlining why you would like to apply and addressing queries below

• Respond to the following questions,

o When are you available to start?

o Provide evidence of your current internet connection speed (upload and download)?

o Provide evidence of your current computer hardware and system specs?

o Confirm whether you are happy to supply your own internet connection, laptop and headset?

o Outline why you would like to apply for the job?

o Outline why you would be a good fit for the job based on your past experience?

o Current remuneration and expected remuneration?



In addition, please complete a short online test by clicking on the link below:





Please note only qualified applicants who meet the minimum criteria, follow the instructions outlined above and who score highly in the online test will be considered for this role. We will only respond to applicants who will be considered further. If you have not heard from us within 7 days of your application, it is likely that your application has been unsuccessful.



Essential Duties

• Saving all
s in the Mercury inbox to relevant client opportunities

• Managing the centralised inbox including,

o Distribution of
s in the centralised inbox to the appropriate people, folders and filing in Mercury

o Setting up auto forward rules and auto-flows to improve efficiency

• Issuing info requests to new clients

• Saving client documents to folders and renaming in accordance with naming convention

• Removing TFNs from documents where appropriate

• Undertaking credit checks on behalf of clients

• Issuing info requests to new clients

• Superior customer service whilst working with various stakeholders including customers, suppliers, referral partners and other staff

• Ensure compliance with all internal and external policies, procedures and processes, and all applicable state and federal banking laws, rules and regulations, and adheres to the National Consumer Credit Protection Act 2009, Privacy Act 1988 and Australian Privacy Principals.

• Conducting rate reviews for existing customers and managing the entire rate review process

• Any other ad hoc tasks and projects required from time to time

• Completes all tasks correctly and on time



You will be provided with appropriate training and supported by our existing team and given the opportunity to progress your career.
