title: Conversion Rate Optimization Specialist, Landing Pages
description:
About LUCYD:

At LUCYD, we’re transforming the world of digital advertising with a focus on wellness, sustainability, and social responsibility. We specialize in compliant advertising for CBD, cannabis, and DTC wellness brands, and we're not just selling products—we're creating positive impact through Conscious Compounds™.



We’re looking for a Conversion Rate Optimization (CRO) Specialist, with a specific focus on landing pages, to join our marketing team. Your main role will be to design, optimize, and analyze landing pages that drive paid social ad performance and increase eCommerce conversions. Add the word "expedition" on your subject line to let us know you read the whole post.



Responsibilities:

Lead Landing Page Strategy: Own the landing page process—from wireframing to writing compelling copy and gathering visual assets

Collaborate with Designers & Developers: Ensure every page is visually stunning and built for high conversion

A/B Testing & Performance Analysis: Analyze data to continuously test and refine landing pages

Funnel Optimization: Audit the full eCommerce funnel and recommend improvements to boost performance



You MUST have the following qualifications:

3+ years of experience in CRO with focus on landing pages & eCommerce funnels

Proficient in Shopify, wireframing tools, and platforms like Unbounce, Leadpages, or similar

Strong analytical skills using Google Analytics, Hotjar, or similar tools

Excellent English communication skills (C1 Advanced level or Native)

Highly collaborative and detail-oriented

Must be available to work Eastern Time (EST/EDT) hours



If you believe you’re the right fit for this role, we’d love to hear from you. Send your portfolio, resume, and a short note about why you’re a great fit. Only applicants who follow all instructions and meet the qualifications will be considered.

We look forward to working with you!

title: Short-Form Video Editor for Viral Social Media Content (Instagram Reels / TikTok)
description:
We’re looking for a talented Short-Form Video Editor to help grow our brand OWNRSHP through high-quality, viral-style content.



OWNRSHP represents ambition, discipline, ownership, and self-belief. Your job will be to turn our raw lifestyle footage into engaging, motivational, and viral-ready videos for Instagram Reels and TikTok.



You’ll also edit inspirational clips and combine them with music, viral audio, and branding to create content that builds strong brand presence.



This role is perfect for someone who understands viral editing, hooks, pacing, and modern social media styles.





Responsibilities



• Edit raw lifestyle clips into engaging short-form content

• Create motivational / viral-style edits using music or trending audio

• Add strong hooks in the first seconds

• Include captions (sometimes), smooth cuts, and clean pacing

• Align videos with OWNRSHP’s premium, motivational brand style

• Add brand logo to final videos/carousel posts

• Bring creative ideas — not just follow instructions





Main Goal:

Create content that drives engagement, virality, and brand growth.



Requirements:

• Experience editing Instagram Reels / TikToks

• Strong understanding of viral editing structure

• Skilled in CapCut, or Premiere Pro, or Final Cut, or similar editing app.

• Good English comprehension

• Reliable internet and communication





Bonus

• Experience with lifestyle or fashion brands

• Familiarity with motivational content

• Creative mindset and idea generation



Compensation



• Pay based on experience (per video or hourly)

• Performance-based increases available







How to Apply (IMPORTANT)



Start your application with:

OWN



Recommended - Please Include:



1. Links to short-form videos you’ve edited



2. Short note explaining:

- The editing platform you use.

- Why you’re a good fit or providing a portfolio/videos that shows your work





Applicants who don’t follow instructions will not be considered.

title: Shopify & CheckoutChamp Developer
description:
We're looking for a developer who lives and breathes CheckoutChamp and Shopify.



---

- Maintain clean version control and documentation so nothing depends on tribal knowledge



---



Requirements



- 2+ years of hands-on experience with CheckoutChamp—setting up the platform, building funnels, and coding custom checkouts

- 2+ years working with Shopify stores

- Fluent in Liquid, HTML, JavaScript, and CSS

- Ability to code easily customizable sections in Shopify (using JSON)

- Experience coding checkout flows and CRM configurations in CheckoutChamp specifically

- Comfortable working asynchronously with a remote team across multiple timezones



---



This Is NOT For You If:



- You don't have real, hands-on experience with CheckoutChamp

- You can't create customizable sections in Shopify

- You're not responsive—we need someone who replies within hours, not days

- You're unorganized or regularly miss deadlines

- You see development as just "making things look good" rather than driving conversions

- You're not comfortable communicating with non-technical people



---



What We Offer



- Potential full-time remote position after trial period

- Work directly with a small, high-output team that’s growing fast

- One brand, one mission—no client juggling

- Opportunity to own and shape the entire technical infrastructure as the company scales



---



Hiring Process:

3. Technical assessment task

We move fast. If you're the right fit, you'll know within a week.



---

title: Senior Invoice & Cost Control Specialist (E-commerce / Dropshipping)
description:
We are a fast-scaling e-commerce company operating in the dropshipping space, currently generating between $500K – $1M per month in revenue. Due to our rapid growth, we are looking for a true A-player to take full ownership of invoice control, cost management, and financial accuracy across our supply chain.



This is not a basic admin role. We are looking for someone sharp, analytical, detail-obsessed, and commercially aware.



Your Responsibilities



Monitor and control all supplier invoices



Verify invoices against quotation sheets and agreed pricing



Accurately track and update Cost of Goods (COGs)



Ensure financial data is consistent and correctly reflected in our systems



Identify pricing discrepancies and negotiate or flag inconsistencies



Work closely with suppliers to lower product costs, especially for winning products



Maintain organized financial documentation and reporting



Continuously optimize margins through cost control initiatives



Who You Are



Highly detail-oriented and structured



Experienced in invoice checking, bookkeeping, or financial control (preferably in e-commerce or dropshipping)



Strong with spreadsheets (Excel / Google Sheets advanced level required)



Commercially minded — you understand margins, pricing, and profitability



Proactive and independent — you take ownership



Comfortable working in a high-revenue, fast-paced environment



Excellent communicator



We operate at scale, and mistakes in this role are costly. We expect precision, accountability, and initiative.



If you’re applying, start your application with the word strawberry so we know you read the full description carefully.



This is a long-term opportunity for someone who wants to grow with a serious e-commerce business and play a key role in protecting and increasing profitability.



If you believe you are an A-player and ready to operate at a high level, we would love to hear from you.



Kind regards,

Joel Rondhuis

title: Senior Supply Chain Manager (SCM) & Parcel Panel Controller (PPC)
description:
Senior Supply Chain Manager (SCM) & Parcel Panel Controller (PPC)



E-commerce / Dropshipping | $500K–$1M Monthly Revenue



We are a fast-growing dropshipping company generating between $500K and $1M per month. We are looking for a highly structured, detail-obsessed and performance-driven A-player to fully own our Supply Chain Management and Parcel Panel control.



This role combines operational control, supplier management, refund processing, quality control, and fulfillment monitoring. You will be responsible for protecting our margins, delivery performance, and customer satisfaction.



This is not a beginner role. We need someone who thrives in accountability and precision.



Core Responsibilities

1. Refund & Cancellation Management



Process daily customer refunds.



Coordinate with suppliers for refunds and cancellations, especially for out-of-stock (OOS) items.



Ensure all refunds are logged and reconciled against supplier invoices.



Maintain 100% same-day supplier refund requests.



Zero missed OOS refund claims.



2. Order & Fulfillment Management



Monitor open Shopify orders daily.



Ensure no order remains open longer than 8 days.



Track fulfillment progress via Parcel Panel.



Investigate supplier delays and follow up immediately.



Escalate orders with delays over 48 hours, return-to-sender cases, pick-up issues, or address problems.



3. Parcel Panel Control



Verify that every fulfilled order has valid tracking information.



Ensure tracking statuses progress correctly (in transit, delivered, etc.).



Monitor supplier shipping speed and fulfillment times.



Check 150–250 orders per hour minimum.



Flag missing tracking numbers or incomplete fulfillments.



Provide daily summary reports.



Share weekly supplier performance reports.



4. Quality Control & Risk Monitoring



Perform daily quality checks on supply chain operations.



Review “best” and “risky” products weekly.



Enforce supplier quality standards.



Identify recurring fulfillment or product quality issues.



Support weekly supplier performance reviews.



5. Inventory & Pricing Oversight



Conduct weekly stock inventory checks (every Monday without exception).



Flag risky or unstable products.



Monitor product stability and supplier reliability.



Support margin protection by identifying issues early.



6. SOP Compliance & Communication



Ensure all SOPs are followed and up to date.



Monitor
 follow-up timelines to guarantee customers receive timely updates.



Maintain structured reporting and clean documentation.



Key Performance Indicators (KPIs)



Refund Accuracy



100% same-day logging and supplier requests.



Zero missed OOS refund claims.



Order Management



0 orders open longer than 8 days.



Fulfillment Monitoring



All 48h+ delays escalated immediately.



No missing tracking numbers.



Minimum 150–250 orders checked per hour.



Inventory Control



100% weekly stock check every Monday.



Reporting & Compliance



Daily summary reports submitted without delay.



Weekly supplier performance review delivered consistently.



All SOP timelines enforced and up to date.



Who You Are



Extremely detail-oriented.



Structured and disciplined.



Strong in Shopify, spreadsheets, and fulfillment systems.



Experienced in dropshipping or high-volume e-commerce.



Comfortable managing large order volumes.



Proactive and solution-driven.



Able to work independently without constant supervision.



Mentally strong in fast-paced, high-revenue environments.



If you are applying, start your application with the word strawberry so we know you read everything carefully.



We operate at scale. Small mistakes create big problems. We expect ownership, precision, and initiative.



This is a long-term opportunity for someone who wants to grow with a serious e-commerce business.



Kind regards,

Joel Rondhuis

About the Role

It’s ideal for someone who loves organization, coordination, and relationship management — and wants exposure to the creator economy without being commission-based (yet).

This role has a clear growth path into:

description:

We’re a Scottish-based luxury travel company (private, bespoke trips). We need a practical SEO specialist to improve rankings and enquiries through technical fixes, on-page optimisation, content writing, and white-hat backlink outreach.



Pay: 20,000 PHP/month

Start: ASAP

what you did today

what you’ll do next working day

current priority + next deliverable

No spam, no PBNs, no shady tactics. Quality and relevance only

WordPress (required)

Basic HTML/CSS helpful

Scotland Luxury SEO

Tools you use

title: Junior App Testing & Customer Success Trainee
description:
Junior App Testing & Customer Success Trainee – (Bangkok-Remote)

Location: Bangkok?

Language: English is a must & Thai is a bonus?

Commitment: Minimum 8 hours per day, 5 days per week?Duration: 12 months (with potential full time renewal)?

Start Date: ASAP



About Stitch

Stitch is a FashionTech startup transforming how tailor shops and fabric suppliers operate across Asia. Our CRM and BI platform helps traditional tailoring businesses move from paper notebooks and scattered WhatsApp messages to a structured, AI powered system built specifically for their industry.

Already trusted by shops across Thailand and expanding into Hong Kong, Stitch sits at the intersection of fashion, technology, and small business transformation.



Role Overview

This is not a purely desk based role.

You will combine:

Product testing and quality control

In person customer onboarding

Data migration and system setup

Field based customer support in Bangkok

You will work directly with tailor shops and fabric suppliers, helping them transition from paper records to Stitch while also testing the platform to identify bugs, usability issues, and improvement opportunities.

This role requires responsibility, organisation, and comfort interacting with business owners face to face.



Key Responsibilities

App Testing & Quality Control

Test new features before release and document bugs clearly.

Reproduce issues reported by clients and provide structured feedback to the product team.

Identify UX friction points and suggest practical improvements.

Maintain structured testing notes in shared documents.

In Person Customer Success

Visit tailor shops in Bangkok to onboard new users.

Guide shop owners and staff through the Stitch platform step by step.

Answer questions in Thai and provide clear explanations of features.

Ensure clients reach basic operational usage within the first two weeks.

Data Migration & Setup

Upload and structure client measurements, order history, and fabric records.

Digitise paper notebooks and Excel sheets into the Stitch system.

Assist fabric suppliers in publishing digital swatch books and product data.

Verify accuracy of migrated data before final confirmation.

Customer Support & Coordination

Coordinate appointments with shops.

Provide friendly, professional follow up in Thai and English.

Track onboarding progress and report status.

Escalate technical issues clearly to the development team.



Requirements

Based in Bangkok.

Fluent in Thai (spoken and written).

Comfortable communicating in English.

Able to commit to minimum 6 hours per day, 5 days per week.

Available for 6 months minimum, starting ASAP.

Comfortable visiting clients in person across Bangkok.

Detail oriented and patient when handling data entry.

Comfortable using spreadsheets (Google Sheets or Excel).

Confident testing a web application and documenting issues clearly.

Organised and able to work independently.



Preferred but Not Required

Experience in customer service, retail, or support roles.

Familiarity with tailoring, fashion retail, or small business culture.

Basic understanding of SaaS platforms or CRM systems.

Experience doing structured testing or quality control work.



What You Will Gain

Direct exposure to real startup operations.

Experience in SaaS onboarding and product testing.

Hands on field experience with tailor shops and fabric suppliers.

Mentorship from the Stitch founding team.

Clear operational responsibilities, not shadowing work.

Transportation reimbursement for approved client visits.

Possibility to transition into a paid full time role if performance and alignment are strong after 6 months.



Important

It requires consistent presence, reliability, and professional behaviour.

It is best suited for someone who wants practical startup experience and is comfortable working directly with small business owners.



How to Apply

Send your CV and a short message 

Please include:

Why you’re interested in this role.

Any experience with customer support, data handling, or testing.

Confirmation of availability (hours per day, days per week).

Your earliest possible start date.

title: Video Editor for YouTube Channel – Motion Graphics & Shorts
description:
Summary

I'm starting a new YouTube channel focused on AI, automation, and marketing. I'm looking for a talented video editor to help bring this channel to life.



## What I Am Looking For



I need a video editor who can take raw scene clips and turn them into polished, engaging content — both as standalone Shorts and as a full-length YouTube video. You should be comfortable with motion graphics, on-screen overlays, and creating content that keeps viewers watching. I value speed, consistency, and a strong creative eye.



## What You'll Be Doing



Each video consists of approximately 6 short scenes (100–120 seconds each). Your workflow for every video will be:



1. Take each individual scene (100–120 second clips) and edit them as standalone YouTube Shorts — clean transitions, text overlays, relevant graphics, and motion elements that make each Short feel polished and engaging on its own. Some videos will have fewer scenes since not all scenes will be ‘Short-worthy,’ but I record in 120-second increments, so the full video is around 8 minutes and will have around 6 scenes.



2. Merge all 6 edited scenes together into one cohesive long-form YouTube video with smooth transitions between scenes, consistent branding, and professional pacing.



So every deliverable set includes around 3–6 Shorts + 1 full YouTube video



## Specific Skills Needed



Proficient in CapCut Pro (this is required — no exceptions). Motion graphics and animated overlays including lower thirds, callouts, kinetic text, and relevant on-screen graphics. Strong sense of pacing, transitions, and visual storytelling. Experience editing YouTube content specifically, with an understanding of retention, hooks, and platform best practices. Ability to create vertical Shorts from horizontal footage with proper reframing.



## To Apply



Got it — here is the **fully consolidated, final version** with your software experience questions added and everything cleaned up and ready to post/apply:



---



## To Apply



You **must** include your portfolio or reel in your proposal. Applications without a portfolio will not be considered.



Please answer the following:



1. Do you have experience with **Adobe Premiere**, **Adobe After Effects**, and **CapCut**?

2. How many years of experience do you have with each tool?

3. Please provide your portfolio or reel (required).



Also, share examples of YouTube videos and/or Shorts you’ve edited — especially any work that includes motion graphics or overlay work. Bonus points if you can provide before-and-after examples showing raw footage compared to the final edit.



There is an opportunity for this role to become full-time. However, I’m looking to start with someone on a freelance or per-video basis. As we begin working together, there will be a high volume of videos, and for the right candidate, I’m open to transitioning into a full-time position.



I’m looking forward to finding a long-term editor who can grow with the channel. If you’re fast, creative, and detail-oriented, I’d love to hear from you.



---

The Virtual Assistant supports the day-to-day operations of Walkers Cleaning by handling administrative tasks, communication, scheduling, documentation, and follow-ups. The VA frees up the Founder and Operations Manager to focus on sales, growth, and high-level operations, while ensuring all internal processes run smoothly and nothing falls through the cracks.

s professionally, quickly, and clearly.

. 

Follow up with clients on satisfaction, service delivery, and consumables.

, Google Workspace, WhatsApp, and basic task management tools.

title: Solar Lead-to-Quote Coordinator
description:
Please send your resume in PDF format.



We are looking for a detail-oriented Solar Lead-to-Quote Coordinator to manage the end-to-end process of converting solar bird proofing leads into accurate, professional quotes within a 24-hour turnaround. This role follows a defined SOP and requires hands-on work in Go High Level (GHL), aerial measurement tools, and document preparation to ensure every lead is quoted correctly and tracked accurately in the CRM.



Key Responsibilities / Duties

A. Lead Management & CRM Updates

Monitor and manage new solar bird proofing leads in Go High Level (GHL)

Review and qualify lead details and create opportunities in the CRM pipeline

Ensure all leads are worked in the correct order, starting with the oldest

Update CRM records, notes, job status, and pipeline stages accurately



B. Measurement & Quote Preparation

Measure solar panel lineal metres using aerial mapping tools (Metromap)

Capture clear screenshots showing the measured solar panel areas

Gather all required quote information, including client details, measurements, and approved pricing

Generate accurate, well-formatted solar bird proofing quotes using ChatGPT and the approved wording and structure



C. Quote Finalisation & Client Communication

Transfer generated quotes into the approved Word quote template

Insert aerial measurement screenshots and review formatting, spelling, and pricing

Save completed quotes as PDFs using the correct file-naming convention

Send quote PDFs to clients via Outlook within 24 hours of lead receipt



D. Coordination & Process Compliance

Organise and schedule job dates and times with clients once quotes are approved

Coordinate and schedule installers for confirmed jobs

Ensure each service is clearly listed and priced as a separate line item

Follow all SOP rules to ensure accuracy, consistency, and timely delivery



Key Software & Tools

Go High Level (GHL) – lead management, opportunities, pipeline updates

Metromap (or similar aerial measurement tools)

ChatGPT (for quote generation using approved prompts)

Microsoft Word (quote templates), Outlook 
)

Google Drive

Pricing rate sheets



Required Skills & Attributes

Experience working in Go High Level (GHL) or a similar CRM environment

Strong all-round computer literacy and confidence using multiple software platforms

Ability to follow structured processes and SOPs with high accuracy

Ability to quickly learn and adapt to new systems and tools

Fluent written and spoken English

Professional, clear communication when dealing with clients

High attention to detail, particularly in measurements, pricing, and documentation

title: DTC Video Editor (Full time)
description:
We're hiring a Video Editor at KonvertAds



(Not for beginners. Not for people who "know how to edit.)



We are looking for  someone who's been in the trenches, edited 100+ UGCs, knows what makes direct response creative actually convert, and wants to work with some of the biggest health, supplement, and beauty brands out there



Here's what's in it for you:

- $1,500/month starting, goes up to $3,000 with performance bonuses

- Full-time role, remote

- Work on accounts spending serious money on Meta - you'll see what actually works at scale



Apply only if you have...

- 3+ years editing experience, specifically in DTC/ecom space

- 100+ UGC and short-form edits under your belt

- Comfortable with AI tools for video generation and editing

- Done VSL edits, UGC edits, AI voiceover with B-roll - all of it

- Obsessive attention to detail - the kind where you notice things others completely miss

(Agency experience is a big plus)



What the work looks like:

- 12-15 video ads per week minimum, 2-3 per day

- Direct response edits built to convert, not just look good

- High standards - quality cannot drop regardless of volume, that's non-negotiable here

- Every edit needs intent behind it, not just clean cuts

- Add "Konvert" in your subject line or else your applications can be rejected (again attention to detail) 



Who this is NOT for:

- Beginners looking to learn on the job

- People who edit for aesthetics but don't understand direct response

- Anyone who thinks volume means dropping quality

- People who can't handle feedback or move fast



If you've put in the reps, understand what makes people stop scrolling and actually buy, and can maintain top quality while producing real volume



Send me your portfolio and tell me what you can be the best fit (expecting a 1 min personalised loom) 



Apply now and join the coolest team  (Fun fact: everyone in the agency is under 25)

title: Part-Time Automation & Reporting Virtual Assistant (Zapier / n8n)
description:
About the Role

We are a growing operations consulting firm supporting consumer product brands across DTC, wholesale, and marketplace channels. We are seeking a part-time Virtual Assistant with strong automation skills to help build, maintain, and improve reporting workflows using Zapier and/or n8n.

This role is ideal for someone who enjoys turning messy operational data into clean, reliable reporting and can work independently to design and troubleshoot automations across multiple platforms.



Key Responsibilities

Automation & Integrations

Build and maintain automations using Zapier and/or n8n

Create workflows that pull data from:

Shopify

Amazon Seller Central

Faire

Other ecommerce or wholesale sales platforms

Automate data flows into Google Sheets for daily, weekly, and monthly reporting

Sync financial and operational data from:

QuickBooks Online

Payroll / HR platforms (e.g., Justworks)

Set up error handling, alerts, and data validation within workflows

Reporting & Data Management

Structure Google Sheets for:

Sales reporting

Inventory & order tracking

Profitability and margin analysis

Ensure consistent field mapping and clean data across sources

Help document workflows and provide light SOPs for future scaling

Optimization & Support

Troubleshoot broken automations and improve existing workflows

Identify opportunities to reduce manual work through automation

Support multiple brands with similar reporting frameworks while allowing flexibility for growth



Required Skills & Experience

Hands-on experience with Zapier and/or n8n (required)

Strong working knowledge of Google Sheets (formulas, structure, data hygiene)

Experience integrating ecommerce or financial platforms, ideally:

Shopify

Amazon Seller Central

Faire

QuickBooks Online

Comfortable working with APIs, webhooks, or custom fields (at a light to moderate level)

Detail-oriented with strong data accuracy instincts

Able to work independently in a remote environment



Nice-to-Have (Not Required)

Experience supporting CPG, ecommerce, or wholesale brands

Familiarity with inventory, fulfillment, or supply-chain reporting

Experience standardizing reporting across multiple businesses

Advanced spreadsheet or light SQL experience



Time Commitment & Structure

Part-time: ~5–15 hours per week (flexible)

Fully remote

Project-based work with ongoing needs

Opportunity to grow hours and responsibility over time



How to Apply

Please include: - A brief overview of your experience with Zapier and/or n8n - Examples of automations or reporting workflows you’ve built - Platforms you’ve integrated previously





Automation Skills Assessment (Short Test)

Purpose: This exercise helps us understand how you approach automation logic, data structure, and troubleshooting. This is not expected to take more than 30–45 minutes.



Scenario

You are supporting a consumer products brand that sells through Shopify (DTC) and Faire (Wholesale). The operations team wants a daily sales report automatically updated in Google Sheets.

Data Sources

Shopify – Orders

Faire – Orders



Task 1: Automation Design (Written)

Describe how you would set up an automation using Zapier or n8n that: - Pulls daily order data from Shopify and Faire - Sends the data into one Google Sheet with separate tabs for: - Shopify Orders

- Faire Orders

Please include: - Trigger(s) you would use - Key fields you would map (order date, order ID, SKU, quantity, gross sales, discounts, net sales) - How you would prevent duplicate entries



Task 2: Reporting Structure (Written)

Explain how you would structure the Google Sheet to support: - Daily sales totals by channel - Weekly and monthly rollups - Easy expansion to add Amazon later

(Optional: include a screenshot or simple table outline.)



Task 3: Error Handling & Maintenance (Written)

Answer briefly: - How would you handle failed automations or missing data? - What alerts or checks would you put in place? - How would you document this automation for future reference?



Submission Instructions

Please submit: - Written responses (bullet points are fine) - Optional screenshots or diagrams

There are no trick questions — we are looking for clarity of thought, logic, and real-world experience.



Please
 responses to 
 with the subject:  Automation Expert | YOUR NAME

title: Social media marketing manager
description:
Role Summary

The Virtual Assistant is responsible for the execution, management, and reporting of all 

digital marketing systems for the business. This role does not involve strategy creation, branding 

decisions, or content ideation. All work is based on approved direction, frameworks, and 

recorded content provided by leadership.

Primary focus areas:

• YouTube (long-form, shorts, ads)

• Google Ads (search, brand, retargeting)

• Social media posting & scheduling

• Reporting and optimization

CORE RESPONSIBILITIES OVERVIEW

The VA is accountable for:

• Building and maintaining YouTube infrastructure

• Building and maintaining Google Ads infrastructure

• Publishing and managing social content

• Monitoring performance and reporting results

• Ensuring consistency, compliance, and execution accuracy

YOUTUBE – BUILD, MANAGE, SCALE

YouTube Channel Management

Channel Setup & Optimization

The VA is responsible for:

• Channel optimization (banner, bio, links)

• About section setup with approved messaging

• Linking website, social platforms, and contact info

• Ensuring brand consistency across the channel

Long-Form YouTube Content (Weekly)

Execution Only – Content Provided

VA Responsibilities:

• Upload 1 long-form video per week

• Optimize title (SEO-focused, not clickbait)

• Write descriptions with keywords and links

• Add relevant tags

• Create thumbnail in Canva

• Add chapters/timestamps

• Schedule publishing

YouTube Shorts (3–5 per week)

VA Responsibilities:

• Clip long-form videos into short-form content

• Format for vertical viewing

• Add captions/subtitles

• Upload to:

o YouTube Shorts

o Instagram Reels

o TikTok

• Maintain posting consistency

YouTube Ads Management

Ad Types

• In-stream skippable ads

• Shorts ads

• Retargeting ads

VA Responsibilities:

• Upload provided video ads

• Set geographic targeting (approved service areas only)

• Set budgets and bidding strategies

• Monitor performance metrics:

o View rate

o Cost per view

o Click-through rate

• Pause underperforming ads

• Scale performing ads

YouTube Reporting

Weekly:

• Videos posted

• Views

• Watch time

• Subscriber growth

Monthly:

• Best-performing videos

• Shorts performance

• Ad spend vs results

• Recommendations for optimization (not new ideas)

GOOGLE ADS – BUILD & MANAGE 

(HIGH PRIORITY)

Google Ads Account Setup

The VA is responsible for:

• Structuring the Google Ads account correctly

• Separating campaigns by intent

• Connecting landing pages

• Ensuring all conversion tracking works properly

Google Ads Campaign Types

1. Search Ads – Seller Intent

• Keywords focused on selling homes

• Traffic sent to home valuation or seller consultation pages

2. Search Ads – Buyer Intent

• Keywords focused on buyers

• Traffic sent to buyer consultation pages

3. Brand Protection Campaign

• Business name

• Team name

• Individual name

• Common misspellings

Purpose: prevent competitors from capturing branded traffic.

Google Ads Execution Responsibilities

Setup

• Keyword research (local, high intent)

• Campaign and ad group creation

• Writing compliant ad copy

• Adding extensions (call, location, lead form where approved)

• Setting geographic targeting

• Setting ad schedules

Ongoing Management

• Weekly search term review

• Adding negative keywords

• Bid adjustments

• Budget pacing

• Pausing low-performing ads

• Scaling winning keywords and ads

Conversion Tracking (Required)

The VA must ensure tracking for:

• Form submissions

• Phone calls

• Booking confirmations

• Thank-you page views

Tools:

• Google Ads

• Google Analytics

• Google Tag Manager

No ads run without confirmed conversion tracking.

Google Ads Reporting

Weekly:

• Spend

• Leads generated

• Cost per lead

• Top converting keywords

Monthly:

• Campaign comparison

• Buyer vs seller performance

• Conversion rates

• Optimization actions taken

SOCIAL MEDIA – POSTING & 

DISTRIBUTION

Platforms Managed

•

• Instagram

• TikTok

• YouTube Shorts

Posting Expectations

• 5 feed posts per week

• Daily stories (Monday–Friday)

• All content scheduled in advance

VA Responsibilities:

• Write captions from approved frameworks

• Schedule posts

• Add hashtags and location tags

• Monitor comments and DMs

• Flag leads for follow-up

• Maintain brand voice consistency

TOOLS THE VA MUST USE

• YouTube Studio

• Google Ads Manager

• Google Analytics

• Google Tag Manager

• Meta Business Suite

• Canva

• CapCut or Descript

• CRM (as provided)

REPORTING & COMMUNICATION

Weekly Deliverables

• Posting confirmation

• Lead count

• Ad spend summary

• Issues or flags

Monthly Deliverables

• Performance summary

• Cost per lead

• Platform growth

• Optimization actions taken

PERFORMANCE EXPECTATIONS

The VA is evaluated on:

• Consistency of execution

• Accuracy of setup

• Lead delivery reliability

• Reporting clarity

• Proactive optimization (not new strategy

title: Remote Video Editor – UGC / Social Ads
description:
We are looking for a skilled and reliable video editor to work full-time remotely and produce short-form UGC content for social media and ads. You will work with b-roll and Danish voiceover provided by us and turn it into engaging videos that perform on TikTok, Instagram Reels, and Meta Ads.



Your responsibilities will include:



Editing raw b-roll + Danish voiceover into short, engaging videos (15–60 seconds).



Adding hooks, pacing, subtitles, and captions.



Creating simple motion graphics and overlays.



Producing multiple versions of videos for A/B testing and different social platforms.



Delivering completed videos on time, according to set KPIs.



Qualifications:



Minimum 1–2 years of experience in social media / UGC video editing.



Portfolio showcasing short-form videos (TikTok, Instagram Reels,
 Ads, etc.).



Proficient in CapCut, Premiere Pro, DaVinci Resolve, or After Effects.



Able to follow detailed briefs and cue sheets in English/Danish.



Creative, detail-oriented, and capable of working independently.



Bonus:



Experience with performance creatives and social media ads.



Familiarity with TikTok/Instagram trends.



Test Task:



Serious candidates will be asked to complete a short paid test task:



2–3 b-roll clips + Danish voiceover provided.



Produce one 15–30 second social video with hook, pacing, captions, and subtitles.



Paid test: approx. $25–$50.



Evaluation criteria: hook effectiveness, pacing, creative use of b-roll, subtitle quality.



Working Hours:



Full-time: 40 hours/week.



Flexible schedule possible, but video delivery must meet deadlines.

title: Remote Admin Assistant (Part-Time to Full-Time)
description:
Company: On Track Learning (OTL)

Location: Remote (Philippines-based)

Schedule: Part-time (4 hours/day) | PST Time Zone (Typical shift: 12:00 PM – 4:00 PM PST)

Compensation: USD $4.00/hr starting ($4.50/hr after 1 month) + yearly appraisals



About On Track Learning (OTL)

On Track Learning is dedicated to helping students reach their academic and test prep goals through personalized tutoring and proven strategies. We are a mission-driven team that values growth, creativity, and student success. As we scale, we are looking for a reliable, detail-oriented Administrative Assistant to be the "glue" that keeps our operations running smoothly.



Role Overview

You will be at the heart of our daily operations—managing the bridge between parents, students, and tutors. This role begins as a part-time position (20 hours/week) with a clear path to transition into a Full-Time role during our peak seasons.



What You’ll Do

- Client Management: Handle incoming requests, communicate professionally with parents and students, and assist with booking sessions.

- Onboarding: Facilitate the seamless onboarding of new students and tutors to the OTL platform.

- Strategic Matching: Play "matchmaker" by pairing students with the best-fit tutors based on academic needs and personality.

- Coordination: Ensure all parties (tutors, parents, and students) are aligned and informed regarding schedules and expectations.



What We’re Looking For

- Customer Service Pro: Proven background in CS with excellent English communication skills.

- Remote-Ready: Previous experience in a remote setup is a major plus.

- Highly Organized: You are someone who requires minimal supervision and has a high level of Integrity (this is our s3cr3t w0rd!) in their work.

- Detail-Oriented: You catch the small things that others miss and take pride in accuracy.

- Communication: Excellent written and verbal English skills are essential for communicating with our US-based clients.

- Reliability: Stable internet connection and a quiet workspace suitable for the PST late-afternoon shift.



Why Join OTL?

- Growth Potential: We aren’t just looking for a task-taker; we want someone who wants to grow with us as we expand.

- Supportive Culture: Work in a flexible environment where your input is valued, and your creativity is encouraged.

- Impact: Directly contribute to the academic success of students and the growth of OTL’s digital presence.



How to Apply:

- To apply, please message us here with a link to your updated CV and a brief cover letter outlining your Customer Service experience. To ensure you have read this entire posting, please include the SECRET WORD mentioned above in the subject line of your message. Applications that do not follow these instructions or are missing the secret word in the subject line will not be considered.

title: Customer Care & Sales Assistant
description:
Outbound Relationship & Cross-Sell Specialist



Adelfia Insurance is seeking a high-performing Customer Care & Sales Virtual Assistant to join one of the top-performing independent insurance agencies in the country. This role is outbound-focused, working directly with our existing book of business to strengthen client relationships, generate referrals and reviews, and identify cross-sell opportunities.



You will not be cold calling strangers — you will be calling current customers who already trust our agency.



PLEASE READ CAREFULLY BEFORE APPLYING



-Must speak and write English at an expert level

-Full-time position: Monday–Friday, 9:00 AM – 5:00 PM PST

-Comfortable making high-volume outbound calls

-Sales-minded, confident on the phone, and relationship-driven

-Primary Responsibilities (Sales & Lead Generation Focus)

-Make outbound calls to existing customers in our book of business

-Conduct customer experience check-ins and request Google reviews

-Identify and tee up cross-sell opportunities, including:

-Auto & Home multi-policy opportunities

-Personal lines add-ons

-Life insurance opportunities

-Warm-transfer or schedule follow-ups with licensed agents when sales opportunities are identified

-Document conversations, opportunities, and notes clearly in the CRM

-Maintain a professional, friendly, and confident phone presence that reflects our brand

-Secondary Responsibilities (Customer Care Support)

-Perform basic policy reviews with customers

-Assist with billing questions and policy documents (ID cards, COIs, etc.)

-Handle inbound calls when needed and route appropriately

-Support pending cancellation outreach and retention efforts

-CRM management and task follow-up

-Spanish speaking is preferred but not required



Who We’re Looking For



We are looking for self-driven “A-players” who:



Enjoy talking to people and building rapport quickly



Are comfortable asking questions that lead to sales opportunities



Take ownership of their results and daily activity



Learn fast, follow systems, and execute consistently



Have a positive attitude and strong work ethic



Care about doing what’s right for the customer



Insurance experience is NOT required.

We provide full training, scripts, and systems — if you bring the effort and mindset, we will give you the tools to succeed.



Work Environment & Expectations



Fast-paced, organized, and results-driven



Clear daily activity expectations



Strong emphasis on accountability and follow-through



Your goal is always to serve the customer well while uncovering opportunities to better protect them

title: Social Media Specialist
description:
Social Media Specialist for E-Commerce Company (Remote - PH)

Overview

Are you a social-media-savvy creative who lives and breathes digital trends? We are seeking an energetic Social Media Specialist to join our team and help bring the Azure brands to life across the globe.

Working directly under our Social Media Marketing Manager, you will help to create scroll-stopping content and engaging with our community. If you have a passion for homeware, toys and stationery and know how to make a brand grow on screens, we want to hear from you.

About Us

Founded in London in 2016, our commitment to design led us to be recognized as one of the FT 1000 Fastest Growing Companies in Europe. At Azure, we transform everyday life through inspired products in homeware, toys and stationery. 

Responsibilities

Content Creation: Produce high-quality, engaging short-form videos (Reels/TikToks) and static posts that align with our brands’ aesthetic.

Community Management: Monitor social channels, respond to comments/DMs, and foster a positive community around our brands.

Execution: Schedule and publish daily content across all socials TikTok, Instagram, and

Affiliate Support: Assist the Manager in identifying and reaching out to potential affiliates and UGC creators.

 Support: Help build and format
 newsletters.

AI Integration: Use AI tools to assist in caption writing, image editing, and speeding up the production workflow.

Requirements

1–2 years of experience in Social Media Management or Content Creation (e-commerce experience is a huge plus).

Portfolio Required: We want to see your work! Please provide links to accounts you’ve managed or a portfolio of your video/design work.

Tech Savvy: Proficient in mobile editing apps (CapCut, Canva, etc.) and a quick learner of new AI tools.

Communication: Strong written English for crafting clever captions and engaging with customers.

Mindset: A "can-do" attitude—you’re excited to try new ideas and pivot when trends change.



Perks and Benefits

• Fully remote position

• Opportunity to be part of a dynamic and innovative team shaping the future of e-commerce

Join Azure and embark on an exciting journey in the world of e-commerce. We can't wait to welcome you aboard! Act now to secure your spot on our socials team.

Benefits:

Schedule:

title: Sr Software Developer
description:
About the Role

We're looking for a Senior Software Engineer to join our product engineering team. You'll play a key role in building and scaling high-impact features for our core products, using modern web technologies and cloud infrastructure.

What You'll Do



Design, develop, and maintain full-stack web applications using React and Next.js.

Architect and implement backend services on AWS, including serverless components, APIs, and data pipelines.

Work with SQL databases to model data, optimize queries, and ensure performant applications.



Lead OAuth implementations for secure authentication and authorization flows (e.g., OAuth 2.0, OpenID Connect, integrations with providers like Google, Auth0).



Build and test features in sandbox environments, focusing on thorough end-to-end testing, CI/CD pipelines, and production readiness.



Collaborate closely with product, design, and QA teams to deliver polished, user-centric products from concept to launch.

Mentor junior engineers and contribute to code reviews, architecture decisions, and best practices.



What We're Looking For



5+ years of professional software engineering experience, with a focus on full-stack web development.

Expert-level proficiency in React and Next.js (including SSR, API routes, and performance optimization).

Strong experience with AWS services (e.g., Lambda, EC2, S3, RDS, Cognito, API Gateway).

Hands-on with SQL (PostgreSQL/MySQL preferred) and data modeling.



Proven track record in OAuth implementations—must be able to discuss specific projects involving secure auth flows.

Experience testing and deploying in sandbox/staging environments, including tools like Jest, Cypress, or Postman for integration testing.



Demonstrated success working on products (not just internal tools or prototypes)—we want engineers who ship features that users love.



Solid understanding of software design principles, microservices, and DevOps practices.

Bonus: Experience with TypeScript, GraphQL, Docker, or CI/CD tools like GitHub Actions.



Why Join Us?



Work on meaningful products that solve real problems.

Competitive salary + equity + benefits.

Flexible remote/hybrid setup with top-tier tools and resources.

A collaborative, product-first culture where your impact is visible.



To Apply:

Send your resume, a link to your GitHub/portfolio, and a brief note on a recent OAuth or product-related project to 

We review applications on a rolling basis—apply today!

title: Merchandise Designer
description:
About the Project



We are developing a limited-edition merchandise collection for a premium digital wellness brand. This is not generic startup swag — the goal is elevated, minimal, culturally relevant apparel that feels modern and intentional.



We’re looking for a detail-oriented Virtual Assistant with strong design skills to help bring this to life quickly.



What You’ll Be Doing



Designing apparel graphics for:



T-shirts



Crewnecks



Hats



Socks



Translating brand guidelines into clean, wearable designs



Creating print-ready files (SVG, PDF, high-res PNG)



Mocking up designs on apparel blanks



Iterating quickly based on feedback



Maintaining visual consistency across the collection



Style Direction



The aesthetic is:



Minimal



Modern



Editorial



Slightly hypebeast / streetwear influenced



Premium, not loud



No clipart, no gimmicks, no heavy graphics



Think:

Clean typography, subtle iconography, thoughtful spacing, cultural but understated.



What We’re Looking For



Strong eye for minimal and modern apparel design



Comfortable working within brand guidelines (fonts, color palettes, tone)



Fast turnaround and responsive communication



Experience designing for merch or apparel brands



Comfortable in Canva, Figma, Illustrator, or similar tools



Ability to create clean vector graphics



Application Requirements



To apply, please include:



A portfolio of previous apparel or merch designs

(especially examples that performed well or sold well)



A short note explaining your design approach to minimal, modern clothing



A sample concept:

Please submit one mock design showing how you believe our brand’s merch could show up.

(Simple concept is fine — we want to see your thinking.)



Timeline



This is a short-term project with fast turnaround.

We are looking to move quickly and finalize designs within 1–2 weeks.

title: Finance & Admin Assistant
description:
We’re looking for a highly organized, numbers-savvy operator to help us stay financially sharp and operationally smooth as we scale our short-term rental business. You’ll own the day-to-day financial admin — from invoicing to investor reports — and help keep our backend tidy, transparent, and ready to grow.



If you love spreadsheets, crave clarity, and get a weird sense of joy from balancing books — keep reading.



What You’ll Be Doing



Balance Sheets & Bookkeeping: Keep our numbers up-to-date, accurate, and ready to report.



Tax & Compliance: Track VAT thresholds, prep filings, and handle tax-related tasks (no last-minute scrambles).



Business Rates: Apply for rates on relevant properties when needed.



Payroll Support: Process monthly payroll and keep tidy records.



Accounts Payable & Receivable: Stay on top of who owes us and who we owe.



Financial Statements: Create clean, clear profit & loss statements that help us make smart decisions.



Invoicing: Send invoices, chase payments, and make sure the cash keeps flowing.



Reporting & Analysis: Build and maintain Excel dashboards showing monthly profit by property, channel performance, occupancy, and more.



Investor Reports: Prep monthly reports detailing income, costs, and payouts for each property.



General Admin: Help with billing, council tax, listing uploads, guest manuals, and other key ops tasks.







What We’re Looking For



Meticulous with numbers, records, and deadlines



Confident in Excel — pivot tables, formulas, charts, the works



Comfortable with bookkeeping tools and financial admin software



Communicates clearly and professionally (especially in writing)



Curious, responsible, and proactive — you don’t wait to be told what’s broken



Bonus: experience in property, hospitality, or short-term rentals







Perks & Upside



Remote flexibility



Learn the ins and outs of short-term rental finance



Clear systems, helpful team, and room to grow with us



High-impact role — your work directly supports growth and investor trust



How to Apply



We don’t need a resume. We need to know how you think and how you work.



Start your application with the word “clarity” so we know you’re paying attention

title: online stream operator
description:
If you’re done with low-paying side gigs and ready to start earning properly, here’s an option worth checking out.

We train guys to become stream operators and guide them into the profession with confidence.

The job is hands-on: you launch and manage live broadcasts, work directly with the model, keep an eye on video quality, framing, and the overall vibe of the stream.

Who we’re looking for: guys 18–27 years old who are open to learning and motivated to grow.



What the role involves:

Setting up and running streams

Assisting models to make sure the broadcast looks clean and professional

Helping develop and grow the channels

What you get:



Fast training — usually 2–3 days

Starting pay: $500–700 per month

After 2–3 months of consistent work: $1300+

Clear path to become a producer if you perform well



For remote work you need:

PC with at least i5 or Ryzen 6-core CPU

GTX 1060 6GB (or better)

RAM (16GB or more)

Stable, fast internet (100 Mbps+)



We’re looking for people who are serious and ready to put in real effort.

title: Podcast Video Editor (
description:
We're an AI education nonprofit looking for a video editor to handle post-production on our podcast. Episodes run 37 mins to 1hr 15 mins.



What the work involves:

• Refining multicam cuts in DaVinci Resolve (3-camera in-studio + remote Riverside recordings)

• Color correction and camera matching

• Audio leveling

• Cutting 2-3 vertical YouTube Shorts per episode

• Cutting a 5-10 min horizontal clip per episode

• Creating thumbnails in Canva



Requirements:

• DaVinci Resolve experience (non-negotiable)

• Long-form podcast or interview editing experience

• AutoPod familiarity is a big plus



This is ongoing weekly work for the right person.



Next steps: We'll start with a short, paid, quick-turnaround test project to see if it's a good fit.
